Ge Ex Le Nu De Jos Jg Ru 1Sa 2Sa 1Ki 2Ki 1Ch 2Ch Ezr Ne Es Job Ps Pr Ec Son Isa Jer La Eze Da Ho Joe Am Ob Jon Mic Na Hab Zep Hag Zec Mal Mt Mr Lu Joh Ac Ro 1Co 2Co Ga Eph Php Col 1Th 2Th 1Ti 2Ti Tit Phm Heb Jas 1Pe 2Pe 1Jo 2Jo 3Jo Jud Re
Low Normal High

The First Epistle of

1 John

SummaryThe book of 1stJohn is a General Epistle (Apostolic Letter). It is written by the Disciple/Apostle John around 85-95 A.D. probably from Ephesus. The key personalities are the Apostles Peter and Paul. Its purpose was to warn about the increasing threat of false teachings and to reassure Christians of their faith and love in Jesus Christ.It was written to combat false teachings that had to do with the denial that Jesus had a genuine human body (1:1). This Gnostic view of matter as being evil led to two responses, asceticism or licentiousness. He very clearly writes to give the true tests of a true Christian. These tests also contradicted the Gnostic licentious approach to Christianity. He gives several means to measure the reality of one’s conversion experience.

•    Chapters 1-2, John reassures believers explaining, “God is Light and in Him is no darkness at all” (1:5). He wrote that if sins were confessed He would cleanse them, because Jesus is the propitiation for “the whole world” (2:2). Because John was aware of the continuing attack of false teachings, he then urged believers not to love and follow after the world because it was not of the Father, and would ultimately pass away. Discernment is necessary to thwart the constant attacks of heresy.

•    In chapters 3-4, He teaches about the love of God and that through His love He sent Jesus, “To destroy the works of the devil” (3:8). Therefore, believers should love each other not only with words but also, “in deed and truth” (3:18), as Jesus commanded.

•    Chapter 5, John exhorts Christians to live by faith because through our faith in Christ we overcome the wickedness of the world. In addition, John writes one of the most powerful and assuring statements concerning the work of Jesus on the cross, “These things I have written to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, so that you may know that you have eternal life” (vs. 13). John wanted all believers to know 100%, that because of their faith and trust in Jesus Christ they would spend all of eternity with Him.
    Outline
  2. 1. The First Test of Fellowship  ( 1:1⁠–⁠2:17 )
  3. a. Understanding Christ and Sin  ( 1:1⁠–⁠10 )
  4. i.   The Word of Life: Jesus Christ  ( 1:1⁠–⁠4 )
  5. ii.  Walking in the Light: View of Sin  ( 1:5⁠–⁠10 )
  6. b. Outward Displays of Understanding  ( 2:1⁠–⁠17 )
  7. i.   Jesus Our Advocate: Obedience  ( 2:1⁠–⁠6 )
  8. ii.  Love Properly  ( 2:7⁠–⁠17 )
  9. 1. A New Commandment: Love One Another  ( 2:7⁠–⁠14 )
  10. 2. Do Not Love the World  ( 2:15⁠–⁠17 )
  11. 2. The Second Test of Fellowship  ( 2:18⁠–⁠3:24 )
  12. a. Understanding Antichrists  ( 2:18⁠–⁠23 )
  13. b. Outward Displays of Understanding  ( 2:24⁠–⁠3:24 )
  14. i.   Remain in Christ: Do Not Be Deceived  ( 2:24⁠–⁠29 )
  15. ii.  Children of God  ( 3:1⁠–⁠24 )
  16. 1. Practice Righteousness  ( 3:1⁠–⁠10 )
  17. 2. Love One Another  ( 3:11⁠–⁠24 )
  18. 3. The Third Test of Fellowship  ( 4:1⁠–⁠21 )
  19. a. Testing the Spirits  ( 4:1⁠–⁠6 )
  20. b. Outward Display of Understanding  ( 4:7⁠–⁠21 )
  21. i.   Love Comes from God  ( 4:7⁠–⁠10 )
  22. ii.  Love One Another  ( 4:11⁠–⁠21 )
  23. 4. The Fourth Test of Fellowship  ( 5:1⁠–⁠21 )
  24. a. Understanding Christ’s Victory  ( 5:1⁠–⁠12 )
  25. i.   Overcoming the World  ( 5:1⁠–⁠8 )
  26. ii.  God’s Testimony about His Son  ( 5:9⁠–⁠12 )
  27. b. Outward Displays of Understanding  ( 5:13⁠–⁠21 )
  28. i.   Effective Prayer  ( 5:13⁠–⁠17 )
  29. ii.  The True God  ( 5:18⁠–⁠21 )

1
The First Test of Fellowship

Understanding Christ and Sin

1 That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life;1 John 1:1
Stats
Rank: #308 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 165 characters, 27 words, 128 letters, 48 vowels, 80 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο ην απ αρχης ο ακηκοαμεν ο εωρακαμεν τοις οφθαλμοις ημων ο εθεασαμεθα και αι χειρες ημων εψηλαφησαν περι του λογου της ζωης

Lit: That which was from the beginning, that which we have heard, that which we have seen with the eyes of us, that which we have gazed upon and the hands of us have handled, concerning the Word of life —

KJV: That which was from the beginning, which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes, which we have looked upon, and our hands have handled, of the Word of life;
References

"That which"
1Jo 2:13: I write to you: fathers: because you have known Him that is from the beginning. I write to you: young men: because you have overcome the wicked one. I write to you: little children: because you have known the Father.
Pr 8:22-31: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of His way: before His works of old.
Isa 41:4: Who has wrought and done it: calling the generations from the beginning? I the LORD: the first: and with the last; I am He.
Mic 5:2: But you: Bethlehem Ephratah: though you be little among the thousands of Judah: yet out of you will he come forth to me that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth have been from of old: from everlasting.
Joh 1:1: 2-18: In the beginning was the Word: and the Word was with God: and the Word was God.
Joh 8:58: Jesus said to them: Truly: truly: I say to you: Before Abraham was: I am.
Re 1:8: 11: 17: 18: I am Alpha and Omega: the beginning and the ending: says the Lord: which is: and which was: and which is to come: the Almighty.
Re 2:8: to the angel of the church in Smyrna write; These things says the first and the last: which was dead: and is alive;

"which we have heard"
1Jo 4:14: We have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.
Lu 1:2: Even as they delivered them to us: which from the beginning were eyewitnesses: and ministers of the word;
Joh 1:14: The Word was made flesh: and dwelt among us: (and we beheld His glory: the glory as of the only begotten of the Father: ) full of grace and truth.
Ac 1:3: To whom also He showed Himself alive after His passion by many infallible proofs: being seen of them 40 days: and speaking of the things pertaining to the kingdom of God:
Ac 4:20: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.
2Pe 1:16-18: For we not have followed cunningly devised fables: when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ: but were eyewitnesses of His majesty.

"and our"
Lu 24:39: Look my hands and my feet: that it is I myself: handle me: and see; for a spirit has not flesh and bones: as you see me have.
Joh 20:27: Then says he to Thomas: Reach here your finger: and look my hands; and reach here your hand: and thrust it into my side: and not be faithless: but believing.

"the Word"
1Jo 5:7: For there are 3 that bear record in heaven: the Father: the Word: and the Holy Ghost: and these 3 are one.
Joh 1:14: The Word was made flesh: and dwelt among us: (and we beheld His glory: the glory as of the only begotten of the Father: ) full of grace and truth.
Joh 5:26: For as the Father has life in Himself; so has He given to the Son to have life in Himself;
Re 19:13: He was clothed with a vesture dipped in blood: and His name is called The Word of God.

2 (For the life was manifested, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and show to you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested to us;)1 John 1:2
Stats
Counts: 161 characters, 25 words, 124 letters, 48 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Greek: και η ζωη εφανερωθη και εωρακαμεν και μαρτυρουμεν και απαγγελλομεν υμιν την ζωην την αιωνιον ητις ην προς τον πατερα και εφανερωθη ημιν

Lit: and the life was made manifest, and we have seen and bear witness, and we proclaim to you the life eternal which was with the Father and was revealed to us —

KJV: (For the life was manifested, and we have seen it, and bear witness, and shew unto you that eternal life, which was with the Father, and was manifested unto us;)
References

"the life"
1Jo 5:11: 20: This is the record: that God has given to us eternal life: and this life is in His Son.
Joh 1:4: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
Joh 11:25: 26: Jesus said to her: I am the resurrection: and the life: He that'>He who believes in me: though He were dead: yet will He live:
Joh 14:6: Jesus says to Him: I am the way: the truth: and the life: no man comes to the Father: but by me.

"was manifested"
1Jo 3:5: 8: you know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.
Ro 16:25: 26: Now to Him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel: and the preaching of Jesus Christ: according to the revelation of the mystery: which was kept secret since the world began:
1Ti 3:16: Without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh: justified in the Spirit: seen of angels: preached to the Gentiles: believed on in the world: received up into glory.
2Ti 1:10: But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ: who has abolished death: and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:
Tit 1:2: In hope of eternal life: which God: that cannot lie: promised before the world began;

"and bear"
Joh 15:27: you also will bear witness: because you have been with me from the beginning.
Joh 21:14: This is now the third time that Jesus showed Himself to His disciples: after that He was risen from the dead.
Ac 1:22: Beginning from the baptism of John: to that same day that he was taken up from us: must one be ordained to be a witness with us of his resurrection.
Ac 2:32: This Jesus has God raised up: whereof we all are witnesses.
Ac 3:15: Killed the Prince of life: whom God has raised from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.
Ac 5:32: We are His witnesses of these things; and so is also the Holy Ghost: whom God has given to them that obey Him.
Ac 10:41: Not to all the people: but to witnesses chosen before of God: even to us: who did eat and drink with Him after He rose from the dead.
1Pe 5:1: The elders which are among you I exhort: who am also an elder: and a witness of the sufferings of Christ: and also a partaker of the glory that will be revealed:

"shew"
1Jo 5:20: We know that the Son of God is come: and has given us an understanding: that we may know Him that is true: and we are in Him that is true: even in His Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God: and eternal life.

"that eternal"
Joh 17:3: This is life eternal: that they might know you the only true God: and Jesus Christ: whom you have sent.

"which was"
Pr 8:22-30: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of His way: before His works of old.
Joh 1:1: 2: 18: In the beginning was the Word: and the Word was with God: and the Word was God.
Joh 3:13: No man has ascended up to heaven: but He that'>He who came down from heaven: even the Son of man which is in heaven.
Joh 7:29: But I know him: for I am from him: and he has sent me.
Joh 8:38: I speak that which I have seen with my Father: and you do that which you have seen with your father.
Joh 16:28: I came forth from the Father: and am come into the world: again: I leave the world: and go to the Father.
Joh 17:5: Now: O Father: glorify you me with your own self with the glory which I had with you before the world was.
Ro 8:3: For what the law not could do: in that it was weak through the flesh: God sending His own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh: and for sin: condemned sin in the flesh:
Ga 4:4: But when the fulness of the time was come: God sent forth His Son: made of a woman: made under the law:

G3739 ὅς hós ho probably a primary word (or perhaps a form of the article ὁ); the relatively (sometimes demonstrative) pronoun, who, which, what, that:--one, (an-, the) other, some, that, what, which, who(-m, -se), etc. See also οὗ., 		ὃho that which RelPro-ANS

G3708 ὁράω horáō hor-ah-o properly, to stare at (compare ὀπτάνομαι), i.e. (by implication) to discern clearly (physically or mentally); by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear:--behold, perceive, see, take heed. 		ἑωράκαμενheōrakamen we have seen V-RIA-1P

G3326μεθ’meth’   (Prep)
G3326 μετά metá met-ah a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; amid (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between ἀπό or ἐκ and εἰς or πρός; less intimate than ἐν and less close than σύν):--after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out). Often used in composition, in substantially the same relations of participation or proximity, and transfer or sequence. 		μεθ’meth’ with Prep

3 That which we have seen and heard declare we to you, that you also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with His Son Jesus Christ.1 John 1:3
Stats
Rank: #1123 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 172 characters, 30 words, 136 letters, 49 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο εωρακαμεν και ακηκοαμεν απαγγελλομεν υμιν ινα και υμεις κοινωνιαν εχητε μεθ ημων και η κοινωνια δε η ημετερα μετα του πατρος και μετα του υιου αυτου ιησου χριστου

Lit: that which we have seen and have heard, we proclaim also to you, so that also you fellowship may have with us. Indeed the fellowship now of us is with the Father, and with the Son of Him, Jesus Christ.

KJV: That which we have seen and heard declare we unto you, that ye also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ.
References

"which"
1Jo 1:1: That which was from the beginning: which we have heard: which we have seen with our eyes: which we have looked upon: and our hands have handled: of the Word of life;
Ac 4:20: For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.

"declare"
1Jo 1:5: This then is the message which we have heard of Him: and declare to you: that God is light: and in Him is no darkness at all.
Ps 2:7: I will declare the decree: the LORD has said to me: You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.
Ps 22:22: I will declare your name to my brothers: in the middle of the congregation will I praise you.
Isa 66:19: I will set a sign among them: and I will send those that escape of them to the nations: to Tarshish: Pul: and Lud: that draw the bow: to Tubal: and Javan: to the isles afar off: that not have heard my fame: neither have seen my glory; and they will declare my glory among the Gentiles.
Joh 17:25: O righteous Father: the world has not known you: but I have known you: and these have known that you have sent me.
Ac 13:32: 41: We declare to you glad tidings: how that the promise which was made to the fathers:
Ac 20:27: For I not have shunned to declare to you all the counsel of God.
1Co 15:1: Moreover: brothers: I declare to you the gospel which I preached to you: which also you have received: and wherein you stand;
Heb 2:12: Saying: I will declare your name to my brothers: in the middle of the church will I sing praise to you.

"ye also"
Ac 2:42: They continued stedfastly in the apostles' doctrine and fellowship: and in breaking of bread: and in prayers.
Ro 15:27: It has pleased them truly; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things: their duty is also to minister to them in carnal things.
Eph 3:6: That the Gentiles should be fellowheirs: and of the same body: and partakers of His promise in Christ by the gospel:
Php 1:7: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all: because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds: and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel: you all are partakers of my grace.
Php 2:1: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ: if any comfort of love: if any fellowship of the Spirit: if any bowels and mercies:
1Ti 6:2: They that have believing masters: let not them despise them: because they are brothers; but rather do them service: because they are faithful and beloved: partakers of the benefit. These things teach and exhort.
Heb 3:1: For what reason: holy brothers: partakers of the heavenly calling: consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession: Christ Jesus;
1Pe 5:1: The elders which are among you I exhort: who am also an elder: and a witness of the sufferings of Christ: and also a partaker of the glory that will be revealed:

"our fellowship"
1Jo 1:7: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
1Jo 2:23: 24: Whoever denies the Son: the same has not the Father: (but) He that'>He who acknowledges the Son has the Father also.
Joh 14:20-23: At that day you will know that I am in my Father: and you in me: and I in you.
Joh 17:3: 11: 21: This is life eternal: that they might know you the only true God: and Jesus Christ: whom you have sent.
1Co 1:9: 30: God is faithful: by whom you were called to the fellowship of His Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
2Co 13:14: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ: and the love of God: and the communion of the Holy Ghost: be with you all. Amen. The second [epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi: a city of Macedonia: by Titus and Lucas.]>>
Php 2:1: If there be therefore any consolation in Christ: if any comfort of love: if any fellowship of the Spirit: if any bowels and mercies:
Php 3:10: That I may know him: and the power of his resurrection: and the fellowship of his sufferings: being made conformable to his death;
Heb 3:14: For we are made partakers of Christ: if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast to the end;

"with his"
1Jo 5:10: 11: He who believes'>believes'>believes on the Son of God has the witness in Himself: He that'>He who believes'>believes'>believes not God has made Him a liar; because He believes'>believes'>believes not the record that God gave of His Son.
Col 1:13: Who has delivered us from the power of darkness: and has translated us into the kingdom of His dear Son:
1Th 1:10: To wait for His Son from heaven: whom He raised from the dead: even Jesus: which delivered us from the wrath to come.

4 These things write we to you, that your joy may be full.1 John 1:4
Stats
Counts: 62 characters, 12 words, 48 letters, 18 vowels, 30 consonants
Translation
Greek: και ταυτα γραφομεν υμιν ινα η χαρα {VAR1: ημων } {VAR2: υμων } η πεπληρωμενη

Lit: And these things write we so that the joy of us might be complete.

KJV: And these things write we unto you, that your joy may be full.
References

"that"
Isa 61:10: I will greatly rejoice in the LORD: my soul will be joyful in my God; for He has clothed me with the garments of salvation: He has covered me with the robe of righteousness: as a groom decks Himself with ornaments: and as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.
Hab 3:17: 18: Although the fig tree will not blossom: neither will fruit be in the vines; the labour of the olive will fail: and the fields will yield no meat; the flock will be cut off from the fold: and there will be no herd in the stalls:
Joh 15:11: These things have I spoken to you: that my joy might remain in you: and that your joy might be full.
Joh 16:24: Hitherto have you not askedhing in my name: ask: and you will receive: that your joy may be full.
2Co 1:24: Not for that we have dominion over your faith: but are helpers of your joy: for by faith you stand.
Eph 3:19: To know the love of Christ: which passs knowledge: that you might be filled with all the fulness of God.
Php 1:25: 26: Having this confidence: I know that I will abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;
2Jo 1:12: Having many things to write to you: I not would write with paper and ink: but I trust to come to you: and speak face to face: that our joy may be full.

5 This then is the message which we have heard of Him, and declare to you, that God is light, and in Him is no darkness at all.1 John 1:5
Stats
Rank: #463 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 127 characters, 24 words, 97 letters, 36 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Greek: και αυτη εστιν η {VAR1: επαγγελια } {VAR2: αγγελια } ην ακηκοαμεν απ αυτου και αναγγελλομεν υμιν οτι ο θεος φως εστιν και σκοτια εν αυτω ουκ εστιν ουδεμια

Lit: And is this the message that we have heard from Him, and we preach to you, that God light is, and darkness in Him, not is none.

KJV: This then is the message which we have heard of him, and declare unto you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all.
References

"the message"
1Jo 3:11: For this is the message that you heard from the beginning: that we should love one another.
1Co 11:23: For I have received of the Lord that which also I delivered to you: That the Lord Jesus the same night in which He was betrayed took bread:

"that God"
Ps 27:1: A Psalm of David.>> The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom will I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom will I be afraid?
Ps 36:9: For with you is the fountain of life: in your light will we see light.
Ps 84:11: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will He withhold from them that walk uprightly.
Isa 60:19: The sun will be no more your light by day; neither for brightness will the moon give light to you: but the LORD will be to you an everlasting light: and your God your glory.
Joh 1:4: 9: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
Joh 8:12: Then spoke Jesus again to them: saying: I am the light of the world: He that'>He who follows me will not walk in darkness: but will have the light of life.
Joh 9:5: As long as I am in the world: I am the light of the world.
Joh 12:35: 36: Then Jesus said to them: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while you have the light: lest darkness come upon you: for He that'>He who walks in darkness knows not whither He goeth.
1Ti 6:16: Who only has immortality: dwelling in the light which no man can approach to; whom no man has seen: nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.
Jas 1:17: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above: and comes down from the Father of lights: with whom is no variableness: neither shadow of turning.
Re 21:23: The city had no need of the sun: neither of the moon: to shine in it: for the glory of God did lighten it: and the Lamb is the light thereof.
Re 22:5: There will be no night there; and they need no candle: neither light of the sun; for the Lord God gives them light: and they will reign for ever and ever.

G3326 μετά metá met-ah a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; amid (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between ἀπό or ἐκ and εἰς or πρός; less intimate than ἐν and less close than σύν):--after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out). 6 If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie, and not do the truth:1 John 1:6
Stats
Rank: #1507 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 95 characters, 17 words, 72 letters, 25 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαν ειπωμεν οτι κοινωνιαν εχομεν μετ αυτου και εν τω σκοτει περιπατωμεν ψευδομεθα και ου ποιουμεν την αληθειαν

Lit: If we should say that fellowship we have with Him, and yet in the darkness should walk, we lie and not do practice the truth.

KJV: If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie, and do not the truth:
References

"If"
1Jo 1:8: 10: If we say that we have no sin: we deceive ourselves: and the truth not is in us.
1Jo 2:4: He who says: I know him: and keeps not his commandments: is a liar: and the truth not is in him.
1Jo 4:20: If a man say: I love God: and hates His brother: He is a liar: for He that'>He who loves not His brother whom He has seen: how can He love God whom He has not seen?
Mt 7:22: Many will say to me in that day: Lord: Lord: have not we prophesied in your name? and in your name have cast out devils? and in your name done many wonderful works?
Jas 2:14: 16: 18: What does it profit: my brothers: though a man say he has faith: and not have works? can faith save him?
Re 3:17: 18: Because you say: I am rich: and increased with goods: and have need not ofhing; and know not that you are wretched: and miserable: and poor: and blind: and naked:

"fellowship"
1Jo 1:3: That which we have seen and heard declare we to you: that you also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father: and with His Son Jesus Christ.
Ps 5:4-6: For you are not a God that has pleasure in wickedness: neither will evil dwell with you.
Ps 94:20: Will the throne of iniquity have fellowship with you: which frames mischief by a law?
2Co 6:14-16: Be you not unequally yoked together with unbelievers: for what fellowship has righteousness with unrighteousness? and what communion has light with darkness?

"walk"
1Jo 2:9-11: He who says he is in the light: and hates his brother: is in darkness even until now.
Ps 82:5: They not know: neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.
Pr 2:13: Who leave the paths of uprightness: to walk in the ways of darkness;
Pr 4:18: 19: But the path of the just is as the shining light: that shines more and more to the perfect day.
Joh 3:19: 20: This is the condemnation: that light is come into the world: and men loved darkness rather than light: because their deeds were evil.
Joh 11:10: But if a man walk in the night: he stumbles: because there is no light in him.
Joh 12:35: 46: Then Jesus said to them: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while you have the light: lest darkness come upon you: for He that'>He who walks in darkness knows not whither He goeth.

"we lie"
1Jo 1:10: If we say that we not have sinned: we make him a liar: and his word not is in us.
1Jo 4:20: If a man say: I love God: and hates His brother: He is a liar: for He that'>He who loves not His brother whom He has seen: how can He love God whom He has not seen?
Joh 8:44: 45: You are of your father the devil: and the lusts of your father you will do. He was a murderer from the beginning: and not abode in the truth: because there is no truth in him. When he speaks'>speaks a lie: he speaks'>speaks of his own: for he is a liar: and the father of it.
1Ti 4:2: Speaking lies in hypocrisy; having their conscience seared with a hot iron;

"do not"
Joh 3:21: But He that'>He who does truth comes to the light: that His deeds may be made manifest: that they are wrought in God.

G3326μετ’met’   (Prep)
G3326 μετά metá met-ah a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; amid (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between ἀπό or ἐκ and εἰς or πρός; less intimate than ἐν and less close than σύν):--after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out). 7 But if we walk in the light, as He is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.1 John 1:7
Stats
Rank: #194 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 153 characters, 29 words, 118 letters, 42 vowels, 76 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαν δε εν τω φωτι περιπατωμεν ως αυτος εστιν εν τω φωτι κοινωνιαν εχομεν μετ αλληλων και το αιμα ιησου χριστου του υιου αυτου καθαριζει ημας απο πασης αμαρτιας

Lit: If however in the light we should walk as He is in the light, fellowship we have with one another, and the blood of Jesus, the Son of Him, cleanses us from all sin.

KJV: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanseth us from all sin.
References

"If we"
1Jo 2:9: 10: He who says he is in the light: and hates his brother: is in darkness even until now.
Ps 56:13: For you have delivered my soul from death: will not you deliver my feet from falling: that I may walk before God in the light of the living?
Ps 89:15: Blessed is the people that know the joyful sound: they will walk: O LORD: in the light of your face.
Ps 97:11: Light is sown for the righteous: and gladness for the upright in heart.
Isa 2:5: O house of Jacob: come you: and let us walk in the light of the LORD.
Joh 12:35: Then Jesus said to them: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while you have the light: lest darkness come upon you: for He that'>He who walks in darkness knows not whither He goeth.
Ro 13:12: The night is far spent: the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness: and let us put on the armour of light.
Eph 5:8: For you were sometimes darkness: but now are you light in the Lord: walk as children of light:
2Jo 1:4: I rejoiced greatly that I found of your children walking in truth: as we have received a commandment from the Father.
3Jo 1:4: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

"as"
1Jo 1:5: This then is the message which we have heard of Him: and declare to you: that God is light: and in Him is no darkness at all.
Ps 104:2: Who cover yourself with light as with a garment: who stretch out the heavens like a curtain:
1Ti 6:16: Who only has immortality: dwelling in the light which no man can approach to; whom no man has seen: nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.
Jas 1:17: Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above: and comes down from the Father of lights: with whom is no variableness: neither shadow of turning.

"we have"
1Jo 1:3: That which we have seen and heard declare we to you: that you also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father: and with His Son Jesus Christ.
Am 3:3: Can two walk together: except they be agreed?

"and the"
1Jo 2:1: 2: My little children: these things write I to you: that you not sin. And if any man sin: we have an advocate with the Father: Jesus Christ the righteous:
1Jo 5:6: 8: This is He that'>He who came by water and blood: even Jesus Christ; not by water only: but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that bears witness: because the Spirit is truth.
Zec 13:1: In that day there will be a fountain opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem for sin and for uncleanness.
Joh 1:29: The next day John sees Jesus coming to Him: and says: Look the Lamb of God: which takes away the sin of the world.
1Co 6:11: Such were some of you: but you are washed: but you are sanctified: but you are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus: and by the Spirit of our God.
Eph 1:7: In whom we have redemption through his blood: the forgiveness of sins: according to the riches of his grace;
Heb 9:14: How much more will the blood of Christ: who through the eternal Spirit offered Himself without spot to God: purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
1Pe 1:19: But with the precious blood of Christ: as of a lamb without blemish and without spot:
Re 1:5: From Jesus Christ: who is the faithful witness: and the first begotten of the dead: and the prince of the kings of the earth. To Him that loved us: and washed us from our sins in His own blood:
Re 7:14: I said to him: Sir: you know. And he said to me: These are they which came out of great tribulation: and have washed their robes: and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

8 If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth not is in us.1 John 1:8
Stats
Rank: #277 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 80 characters, 16 words, 60 letters, 25 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαν ειπωμεν οτι αμαρτιαν ουκ εχομεν εαυτους πλανωμεν και η αληθεια ουκ εστιν εν ημιν

Lit: If we should say that sin not we have, ourselves we deceive, and the truth not is in us.

KJV: If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us.
References

"say"
1Jo 1:6: 10: If we say that we have fellowship with him: and walk in darkness: we lie: and not do the truth:
1Jo 3:5: 6: you know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.
1Ki 8:46: If they sin against you: (for there is no man that sins not: ) and you be angry with them: and deliver them to the enemy: so that they carry them away captives to the land of the enemy: far or near;
2Ch 6:36: If they sin against you: (for there is no man which sins not: ) and you be angry with them: and deliver them over before their enemies: and they carry them away captives to a land far off or near;
Job 9:2: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?
Job 14:4: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
Job 15:14: What is man: that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman: that he should be righteous?
Job 25:4: How then can man be justified with God? or how can He be clean that is born of a woman?
Ps 143:2: not enter into judgment with your servant: for in your sight will no man living be justified.
Pr 20:9: Who can say: I have made my heart clean: I am pure from my sin?
Ec 7:20: For there is not a just man upon earth: that does good: and sins not.
Isa 53:6: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to His own way; and the LORD has laid on Him the iniquity of us all.
Isa 64:6: But we are all as an unclean thing: and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities: like the wind: have taken us away.
Jer 2:22: 23: For though you wash you with nitre: and take you much soap: yet your iniquity is marked before me: says the Lord GOD.
Ro 3:23: For all have sinned: and come short of the glory of God;
Jas 3:2: For in many things we offend all. If any man not offend in word: the same is a perfect man: and able also to bridle the whole body.

"we deceive"
1Co 3:18: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seems to be wise in this world: let him become a fool: that he may be wise.
Ga 6:3: For if a man think himself to be something: when he not ishing: he deceives himself.
2Ti 3:13: But evil men and seducers will wax worse and worse: deceiving: and being deceived.
Jas 1:22: 26: But be you doers of the word: not and hearers only: deceiving your own selves.
2Pe 2:13: will receive the reward of unrighteousness: as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes: sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;

"the truth"
1Jo 2:4: He who says: I know him: and keeps not his commandments: is a liar: and the truth not is in him.
1Ti 6:5: Perverse disputings of men of corrupt minds: and destitute of the truth: supposing that gain is godliness: from such withdraw yourself.
2Jo 1:2: For the truth's sake: which dwells in us: and will be with us for ever.
3Jo 1:3: For I rejoiced greatly: when the brothers came and testified of the truth that is in you: even as you walk in the truth.

G93 ἀδικία adikía ad-ee-kee-ah from ἄδικος; (legal) injustice (properly, the quality, by implication, the act); morally, wrongfulness (of character, life or act):--iniquity, unjust, unrighteousness, wrong. 		ἀδικίας.adikias unrighteousness. N-GFS
9 If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.1 John 1:9
Stats
Rank: #41 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 115 characters, 20 words, 91 letters, 36 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαν ομολογωμεν τας αμαρτιας ημων πιστος εστιν και δικαιος ινα αφη ημιν τας αμαρτιας και καθαριση ημας απο πασης αδικιας

Lit: If we should confess the sins of us, faithful He is and just, that He may forgive us our sins, and might cleanse us from all unrighteousness.

KJV: If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins, and to cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
References

"we confess"
Le 26:40-42: If they will confess their iniquity: and the iniquity of their fathers: with their trespass which they trespassed against me: and that also they have walked contrary to me;
1Ki 8:47: Yet if they will bethink themselves in the land whither they were carried captives: and repent: and make supplication to you in the land of them that carried them captives: saying: We have sinned: and have done perversely: we have committed wickedness;
2Ch 6:37: 38: Yet if they bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive: and turn and pray to you in the land of their captivity: saying: We have sinned: we have done amiss: and have dealt wickedly;
Ne 1:6: Let your ear now be attentive: and your eyes open: that you may hear the prayer of your servant: which I pray before you now: day and night: for the children of Israel your servants: and confess the sins of the children of Israel: which we have sinned against you: both I and my father's house have sinned.
Ne 9:2-37: The seed of Israel separated themselves from all strangers: and stood and confessed their sins: and the iniquities of their fathers.
Job 33:27: 28: He looks upon men: and if any say: I have sinned: and perverted that which was right: and it profited not me;
Ps 32:5: I acknowledged my sin to you: and my iniquity have not I hid. I said: I will confess my transgressions to the LORD; and you forgave the iniquity of my sin. Selah.
Ps 51:2-5: Wash me throughly from my iniquity: and cleanse me from my sin.
Pr 28:13: He who covers his sins will not prosper: but whoever confesss and forsakes them will have mercy.
Da 9:4-20: I prayed to the LORD my God: and made my confession: and said: O Lord: the great and dreadful God: keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love Him: and to them that keep His commandments;
Mt 3:6: Were baptized of him in Jordan: confessing their sins.
Mr 1:5: There went out to him all the land of Judaea: and they of Jerusalem: and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan: confessing their sins.
Ac 19:18: Many that believed came: and confessed: and showed their deeds.

"he is"
De 7:9: Know therefore that the LORD your God: He is God: the faithful God: which keeps covenant and mercy with them that love Him and keep His commandments to a000 generations;
La 3:23: They are new every morning: great is your faithfulness.
1Co 1:9: God is faithful: by whom you were called to the fellowship of His Son Jesus Christ our Lord.
1Ti 1:15: This is a faithful saying: and worthy of all acceptation: that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.
Heb 10:23: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
Heb 11:11: Through faith also Sara herself received strength to conceive seed: and was delivered of a child when she was past age: because she judged him faithful who had promised.

"just"
Isa 45:21: Tell you: and bring them near; yes: let them take counsel together: who has declared this from ancient time? who has told it from that time? have not I the LORD? and there is no God else beside me; a just God and a Saviour; there is none beside me.
Zec 9:9: Rejoice greatly: O daughter of Zion; shout: O daughter of Jerusalem: look: your King comes to you: he is just: and having salvation; lowly: and riding upon an ass: and upon a colt the foal of an ass.
Ro 3:26: To declare: I say: at this time His righteousness: that He might be just: and the justifier of Him which believes in Jesus.
Heb 6:10: For God is not unrighteous to forget your work and labour of love: which you have showed toward His name: in that you have ministered to the saints: and do minister.
Re 15:3: They sing the song of Moses the servant of God: and the song of the Lamb: saying: Great and marvellous are your works: Lord God Almighty; just and true are your ways: you King of saints.

"and to"

Ps 19:12: Who can understand his errors? cleanse you me from secret faults.

1Co 6:11: Such were some of you: but you are washed: but you are sanctified: but you are justified in the name of the Lord Jesus: and by the Spirit of our God.
Eph 5:26: That he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word:
Tit 2:14: Who gave himself for us: that he might redeem us from all iniquity: and purify to himself a peculiar people: zealous of good works.

10 If we say that we not have sinned, we make him a liar, and his word not is in us.1 John 1:10
Stats

Translation

Lit: If we should say that not we have sinned, a liar we make Him, and the word of Him not is in us.

KJV: If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us.

"we say"

"we make"

"his word"

2Jo 1:2: For the truth's sake: which dwells in us: and will be with us for ever.

1 My little children, these things write I to you, that you not sin. And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:1 John 2:1
Stats
Rank: #247 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 152 characters, 24 words, 118 letters, 43 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Greek: τεκνια μου ταυτα γραφω υμιν ινα μη αμαρτητε και εαν τις αμαρτη παρακλητον εχομεν προς τον πατερα ιησουν χριστον δικαιον

Lit: Little children of me, these things I am writing to you so that not you might sin. And if anyone should sin, an advocate we have with the Father, Jesus Christ the Righteous [One].

KJV: My little children, these things write I unto you, that ye sin not. And if any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous:
References

"little"
1Jo 2:12: 13: I write to you: little children: because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.
1Jo 3:7: 18: Little children: let no man deceive you: he who does righteousness is righteous: even as he is righteous.
1Jo 4:4: You are of God: little children: and have overcome them: because greater is He that'>He who is in you: than He that'>He who is in the world.
1Jo 5:21: Little children: keep yourselves from idols. Amen.
Joh 13:33: Little children: yet a little while I am with you. You will seek me: and as I said to the Jews: Whither I go: you cannot come; so now I say to you.
Joh 21:5: Then Jesus says to them: Children: have you any meat? They answered Him: No.
1Co 4:14: 15: I not write these things to shame you: but as my beloved sons I warn you.
Ga 4:19: My little children: of whom I travail in birth again until Christ be formed in you:

"these"
1Jo 1:3: 4: That which we have seen and heard declare we to you: that you also may have fellowship with us: and truly our fellowship is with the Father: and with His Son Jesus Christ.
1Ti 3:14: These things write I to you: hoping to come to you shortly:

"that"
Ps 4:4: Stand in awe: and not sin: commune with your own heart upon your bed: and be still. Selah.
Eze 3:21: Nevertheless if you warn the righteous man: that the righteous not sin: and he does not sin: he will surely live: because he is warned; also you have delivered your soul.
Joh 5:14: Afterward Jesus findeth Him in the temple: and said to Him: Look: you are made whole: sin no more: lest a worse thing come to you.
Joh 8:11: She said: No man: Lord. And Jesus said to her: Neither do I condemn you: go: and sin no more.
Ro 6:1: 2: 15: What will we say then? Will we continue in sin: that grace may abound?
1Co 15:34: Awake to righteousness: and not sin; for some not have the knowledge of God: I speak this to your shame.
Eph 4:26: Be you angry: and not sin: not let the sun go down upon your wrath:
Tit 2:11-13: For the grace of God that brings salvation has appeared to all men:
1Pe 1:15-19: But as he which has called you is holy: so be you holy in all manner of conversation;
1Pe 4:1-3: Forasmuch then as Christ has suffered for us in the flesh: arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for He that'>He who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin;

"And if"
1Jo 1:8-10: If we say that we have no sin: we deceive ourselves: and the truth not is in us.

"we have"
Ro 8:34: Who is He that'>He who condemns? It is Christ that died: yes rather: that is risen again: who is even at the right hand of God: who also makes intercession for us.
1Ti 2:5: For there is one God: and one mediator between God and men: the man Christ Jesus;
Heb 7:24: 25: But this man: because he continues ever: has an unchangeable priesthood.
Heb 9:24: For Christ not is entered into the holy places made with hands: which are the figures of the true; but into heaven itself: now to appear in the presence of God for us:

"Father"
Lu 10:22: All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knows who the Son is: but the Father; and who the Father is: but the Son: and He to whom the Son will reveal Him.
Joh 5:19-26: 36: Then answered Jesus and said to them: Truly: truly: I say to you: The Son can not dohing of Himself: but what He sees the Father do: for what things soever He does'>does: these also does'>does the Son likewise.
Joh 6:27: not Labour for the meat which perishes: but for that meat which endures to everlasting life: which the Son of man will give to you: for Him has God the Father sealed.
Joh 10:15: As the Father knows me: even so know I the Father: and I lay down my life for the sheep.
Joh 14:6: Jesus says to Him: I am the way: the truth: and the life: no man comes to the Father: but by me.
Eph 2:18: For through Him we both have access by one Spirit to the Father.
Jas 1:27: Pure religion and undefiled before God and the Father is this: To visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction: and to keep Himself unspotted from the world.
Jas 3:9: Therewith bless we God: even the Father; and therewith curse we men: which are made after the similitude of God.

"the righteous"
1Jo 2:29: If you know that he is righteous: you know that every one that does righteousness is born of him.
1Jo 3:5: you know that he was manifested to take away our sins; and in him is no sin.
Zec 9:9: Rejoice greatly: O daughter of Zion; shout: O daughter of Jerusalem: look: your King comes to you: he is just: and having salvation; lowly: and riding upon an ass: and upon a colt the foal of an ass.
2Co 5:21: For He has made Him to be sin for us: who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in Him.
Heb 7:26: For such an high priest became us: who is holy: harmless: undefiled: separate from sinners: and made higher than the heavens;
1Pe 2:22: Who did no sin: neither was guile found in his mouth:
1Pe 3:18: For Christ also has once suffered for sins: the just for the unjust: that He might bring us to God: being put to death in the flesh: but quickened by the Spirit:

G2532 καί kaí kahee apparently, a primary particle, having a copulative and sometimes also a cumulative force; and, also, even, so then, too, etc.; often used in connection (or composition) with other particles or small words:--and, also, both, but, even, for, if, or, so, that, then, therefore, when, yet. 		καὶkai And Conj

G4012περὶperi   (Prep)
G4012 περί perí per-ee from the base of πέραν; properly, through (all over), i.e. around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time (with the genitive case denoting the subject or occasion or superlative point; with the accusative case the locality, circuit, matter, circumstance or general period):--(there-)about, above, against, at, on behalf of, X and his company, which concern, (as) concerning, for, X how it will go with, ((there-, where-)) of, on, over, pertaining (to), for sake, X (e-)state, (as) touching, (where-)by (in), with. In comparative, it retains substantially the same meaning of circuit (around), excess (beyond), or completeness (through). 		περὶperi for Prep

2 He is the propitiation for our sins: not and for ours only, but also for the sins of the whole world.1 John 2:2
Stats
Rank: #393 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 105 characters, 20 words, 81 letters, 31 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Greek: και αυτος ιλασμος εστιν περι των αμαρτιων ημων ου περι των ημετερων δε μονον αλλα και περι ολου του κοσμου

Lit: And He the propitiation is for the sins of us; not for the of ours and only, but also for all the world.

KJV: And he is the propitiation for our sins: and not for ours only, but also for the sins of the whole world.
References

"he is"
1Jo 1:7: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
1Jo 4:10: Herein is love: not that we loved God: but that He loved us: and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
Ro 3:25: 26: Whom God has set forth to be a propitiation through faith in His blood: to declare His righteousness for the remission of sins that are past: through the forbearance of God;
1Pe 2:24: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree: that we: being dead to sins: should live to righteousness: by whose stripes you were healed.
1Pe 3:18: For Christ also has once suffered for sins: the just for the unjust: that He might bring us to God: being put to death in the flesh: but quickened by the Spirit:

"for the"
1Jo 4:14: We have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.
1Jo 5:19: And we know that we are of God: and the whole world lies in wickedness.
Joh 1:29: The next day John sees Jesus coming to Him: and says: Look the Lamb of God: which takes away the sin of the world.
Joh 4:42: Said to the woman: Now we believe: not because of your saying: for we have heard Him ourselves: and know that this is indeed the Christ: the Saviour of the world.
Joh 11:51: 52: This spoke He not">not He of Himself: but being high priest that year: He prophesied that Jesus should die for that nation;
2Co 5:18-21: All things are of God: who has reconciled us to Himself by Jesus Christ: and has given to us the ministry of reconciliation;
Re 12:9: The great dragon was cast out: that old serpent: called the Devil: and Satan: which deceives the whole world: he was cast out into the earth: and his angels were cast out with him.

G5083τηρῶμεν.tērōmen   (V-PSA-1P)
G5083 τηρέω tēréō tay-reh-o from (a watch; perhaps akin to θεωρέω); to guard (from loss or injury, properly, by keeping the eye upon; and thus differing from φυλάσσω, which is properly to prevent escaping; and from κουστωδία, which implies a fortress or full military lines of apparatus), i.e. to note (a prophecy; figuratively, to fulfil a command); by implication, to detain (in custody; figuratively, to maintain); by extension, to withhold (for personal ends; figuratively, to keep unmarried); by extension, to withhold (for personal ends; figuratively, to keep unmarried):--hold fast, keep(- er), (pre-, re-)serve, watch. 		τηρῶμεν.tērōmen we should keep. V-PSA-1P
3 Hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.1 John 2:3
Stats
Rank: #839 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 68 characters, 13 words, 53 letters, 18 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Greek: και εν τουτω γινωσκομεν οτι εγνωκαμεν αυτον εαν τας εντολας αυτου τηρωμεν

Lit: And by this we know that we have come to know Him, if the commandments of Him we should keep.

KJV: And hereby we do know that we know him, if we keep his commandments.
References

"hereby"
1Jo 2:4-6: He who says: I know him: and keeps not his commandments: is a liar: and the truth not is in him.
1Jo 3:14: 19: We know that we have passed from death to life: because we love the brothers. He who loves not his brother abides in death.
1Jo 4:13: Hereby know we that we dwell in Him: and He in us: because He has given us of His Spirit.
1Jo 5:19: And we know that we are of God: and the whole world lies in wickedness.

"we know"
Isa 53:11: He will see of the travail of his soul: and will be satisfied: by his knowledge will my righteous servant justify many; for he will bear their iniquities.
Joh 17:3: This is life eternal: that they might know you the only true God: and Jesus Christ: whom you have sent.
2Co 4:6: For God: who commanded the light to shine out of darkness: has shined in our hearts: to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

"if we"
1Jo 3:22: 23: whatever we ask: we receive of him: because we keep his commandments: and do those things that are pleasing in his sight.
1Jo 5:3: For this is the love of God: that we keep His commandments: and His commandments not are grievous.
Ps 119:6: 32: Then will not I be ashamed: when I have respect to all your commandments.
Lu 6:46: Why call you me: Lord: Lord: and not do the things which I say?
Joh 14:15: 21-24: If you love me: keep my commandments.
Joh 15:10: 14: If you keep my commandments: you will abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments: and abide in His love.
1Th 4:1: 2: Furthermore then we beseech you: brothers: and exhort you by the Lord Jesus: that as you have received of us how you ought to walk and to please God: so you would abound more and more.
Heb 5:9: Being made perfect: he became the author of eternal salvation to all them that obey him;
Re 22:14: Blessed are they that do his commandments: that they may have right to the tree of life: and may enter in through the gates into the city.

G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. 4 He who says, I know him, and keeps not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth not is in him.1 John 2:4
Stats
Rank: #2991 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 100 characters, 17 words, 75 letters, 27 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο λεγων εγνωκα αυτον και τας εντολας αυτου μη τηρων ψευστης εστιν και εν τουτω η αληθεια ουκ εστιν

Lit: The one saying - , I have known Him, and the commandments of Him not keeping, a liar he is, and in him the truth not is.

KJV: He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him.
References

"that saith"
1Jo 2:9: He who says he is in the light: and hates his brother: is in darkness even until now.
1Jo 1:6: 8: 10: If we say that we have fellowship with him: and walk in darkness: we lie: and not do the truth:
1Jo 4:20: If a man say: I love God: and hates His brother: He is a liar: for He that'>He who loves not His brother whom He has seen: how can He love God whom He has not seen?
Jas 2:14-16: What does it profit: my brothers: though a man say he has faith: and not have works? can faith save him?

"I know"
Ho 8:2: 3: Israel will cry to me: My God: we know you.
Tit 1:16: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny Him: being abominable: and disobedient: and to every good work reprobate.

"is a"
1Jo 1:6: 8: If we say that we have fellowship with him: and walk in darkness: we lie: and not do the truth:

5 But whoever keeps His word, in Him truly is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in Him.1 John 2:5
Stats
Counts: 106 characters, 20 words, 82 letters, 31 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Greek: ος δ αν τηρη αυτου τον λογον αληθως εν τουτω η αγαπη του θεου τετελειωται εν τουτω γινωσκομεν οτι εν αυτω εσμεν

Lit: Whoever however may keep His word, truly in him the love of God has been perfected. By this we know that in Him we are:

KJV: But whoso keepeth his word, in him verily is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in him.
References

"whoso"
1Jo 2:3: 4: Hereby we do know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.
Ps 105:45: That they might observe His statutes: and keep His laws. Praise you the LORD.
Ps 106:3: Blessed are they that keep judgment: and he who does righteousness at all times.
Ps 119:2: 4: 146: Blessed are they that keep his testimonies: and that seek him with the whole heart.
Pr 8:32: Now therefore listen to me: O you children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.
Pr 28:7: Whoever keeps the law is a wise son: but he who is a companion of riotous men shames his father.
Ec 8:5: Whoever keeps the commandment will feel no evil thing: and a wise man's heart discerns both time and judgment.
Eze 36:27: I will put my spirit within you: and cause you to walk in my statutes: and you will keep my judgments: and do them.
Lu 11:28: But He said: Yes rather: blessed are they that hear the word of God: and keep it.
Joh 14:21: 23: He who has my commandments: and keeps them: He it is that loves'>loves me: and He that'>He who loves'>loves me will be loved of my Father: and I will love Him: and will manifest myself to Him.
Re 12:17: The dragon was angry with the woman: and went to make war with the remnant of her seed: which keep the commandments of God: and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.
Re 14:12: Here is the patience of the saints: here are they that keep the commandments of God: and the faith of Jesus.

"in him"
1Jo 4:12: 18: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.
Jas 2:22: See you how faith wrought with his works: and by works was faith made perfect?

"hereby"
1Jo 2:27: 28: But the anointing which you have received of him abides in you: and you not need that any man teach you: but as the same anointing teaches you of all things: and is truth: and is no lie: and even as it has taught you: you will abide in him.
1Jo 3:24: He that'>He who keeps His commandments dwells in Him: and He in Him. And hereby we know that He abides in us: by the Spirit which He has given us.

Joh 15:5: I am the vine: you are the branches: He who abides in me: and I in him: the same brings forth much fruit: for without me you can not dohing.
Ro 8:1: There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus: who not walk after the flesh: but after the Spirit.
1Co 1:30: But of Him are you in Christ Jesus: who of God is made to us wisdom: and righteousness: and sanctification: and redemption:
2Co 5:17: 21: Therefore if any man be in Christ: He is a new creature: old things are passed away; look: all things are become new.
Col 2:9: 10: For in Him dwells all the fulness of the Godhead bodily.

6 He who says he abides in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.1 John 2:6
Stats
Rank: #1641 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 81 characters, 16 words, 63 letters, 25 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο λεγων εν αυτω μενειν οφειλει καθως εκεινος περιεπατησεν και αυτος ουτως περιπατειν

Lit: The one claiming in Him to abide, ought just as that walk also He in the same way walked.

KJV: He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk, even as he walked.
References

"that saith"
1Jo 2:4: He who says: I know him: and keeps not his commandments: is a liar: and the truth not is in him.
1Jo 1:6: If we say that we have fellowship with him: and walk in darkness: we lie: and not do the truth:

"he"
1Jo 2:28: Now: little children: abide in him; that: when he will appear: we may have confidence: not and be ashamed before him at his coming.
1Jo 3:6: Whoever abides in him sins'>sins not: whoever sins'>sins has not seen him: neither known him.
Joh 15:4-6: Abide in me: and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself: except it abide in the vine; no more can you: except you abide in me.

"to walk"
1Jo 1:7: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
Ps 85:13: Righteousness will go before him; and will set us in the way of his steps.
Mt 11:29: Take my yoke upon you: and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and you will find rest to your souls.
Joh 13:15: For I have given you an example: that you should do as I have done to you.
1Co 11:1: Be you followers of me: even as I also am of Christ.
Eph 5:2: Walk in love: as Christ also has loved us: and has given Himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.
1Pe 2:21: For even hereunto were you called: because Christ also suffered for us: leaving us an example: that you should follow His steps:

7 Brothers, I write no new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you have heard from the beginning.1 John 2:7
Stats
Counts: 174 characters, 28 words, 140 letters, 47 vowels, 93 consonants
Translation
Greek: αδελφοι ουκ εντολην καινην γραφω υμιν αλλ εντολην παλαιαν ην ειχετε απ αρχης η εντολη η παλαια εστιν ο λογος ον ηκουσατε απ αρχης

Lit: Beloved, not a commandment new I am writing to you, but a commandment old, which you have had from the beginning. The commandment old is the word that you have heard.

KJV: Brethren, I write no new commandment unto you, but an old commandment which ye had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which ye have heard from the beginning.
References

"I write"
1Jo 3:11: For this is the message that you heard from the beginning: that we should love one another.
Ac 17:19: They took him: and brought him to Areopagus: saying: May we know what this new doctrine: whereof you speak: is?
2Jo 1:5: Now I beseech you: lady: not as though I wrote a new commandment to you: but that which we had from the beginning: that we love one another.

"but"
Le 19:18: 34: You will not avenge: nor bear any grudge against the children of your people: but you will love your neighbour as yourself: I am the LORD.
De 6:5: you will love the LORD your God with all your heart: and with all your soul: and with all your might.
Mt 5:43: You have heard that it has been said: You will love your neighbour: and hate your enemy.
Mt 22:37-40: Jesus said to Him: You will love the Lord your God with all your heart: and with all your soul: and with all your mind.
Mr 12:29-34: Jesus answered Him: The first of all the commandments is: Hear: O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:
Ro 13:8-10: Owe no man any thing: but to love one another: for he who loves another has fulfilled the law.
Ga 5:13: 14: For: brothers: you have been called to liberty; only use not liberty for an occasion to the flesh: but by love serve one another.
Jas 2:8-12: If you fulfil the royal law according to the scripture: You will love your neighbour as yourself: you do well:

8 Again, a new commandment I write to you, which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past, and the true light now shines.1 John 2:8
Stats
Rank: #3721 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 143 characters, 24 words, 111 letters, 43 vowels, 68 consonants
Translation
Greek: παλιν εντολην καινην γραφω υμιν ο εστιν αληθες εν αυτω και εν υμιν οτι η σκοτια παραγεται και το φως το αληθινον ηδη φαινει

Lit: Again, a commandment new I am writing to you, which is TRUE in Him and in you, because the darkness is passing away, and the light TRUE already shines.

KJV: Again, a new commandment I write unto you, which thing is true in him and in you: because the darkness is past, and the true light now shineth.
References

"a new"
1Jo 4:21: This commandment have we from Him: That He who loves God love His brother also.
Joh 13:34: A new commandment I give to you: That you love one another; as I have loved you: that you also love one another.
Joh 15:12: This is my commandment: That you love one another: as I have loved you.

"which"
1Jo 3:14-16: We know that we have passed from death to life: because we love the brothers. He who loves not his brother abides in death.
1Jo 4:11: Beloved: if God so loved us: we ought also to love one another.
Joh 15:12-15: This is my commandment: That you love one another: as I have loved you.
2Co 8:9: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ: that: though He was rich: yet for your sakes He became poor: that you through His poverty might be rich.
Eph 5:1: 2: Be you therefore followers of God: as dear children;
1Pe 1:21: Who by Him do believe in God: that raised Him up from the dead: and gave Him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.
1Pe 4:1-3: Forasmuch then as Christ has suffered for us in the flesh: arm yourselves likewise with the same mind: for He that'>He who has suffered in the flesh has ceased from sin;

"the darkness"
Song 2:11: 12: For: indeed: the winter is past: the rain is over and gone;
Isa 9:2: The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light: they that dwell in the land of the shadow of death: upon them has the light shined.
Isa 60:1-3: Arise: shine; for your light is come: and the glory of the LORD is risen upon you.
Mt 4:16: The people which sat in darkness saw great light; and to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung up.
Lu 1:79: To give light to them that sit in darkness and in the shadow of death: to guide our feet into the way of peace.
Joh 12:46: I am come a light into the world: that whoever believes on me not should abide in darkness.
Ac 17:30: The times of this ignorance God winked at; but now commands all men every where to repent:
Ac 26:18: To open their eyes: and to turn them from darkness to light: and from the power of Satan to God: that they may receive forgiveness of sins: and inheritance among them which are sanctified by faith that is in me.
Ro 13:12: The night is far spent: the day is at hand: let us therefore cast off the works of darkness: and let us put on the armour of light.
2Co 4:4-6: In whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of them which not believe: lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ: who is the image of God: should shine to them.
Eph 5:8: For you were sometimes darkness: but now are you light in the Lord: walk as children of light:
1Th 5:5-8: You are all the children of light: and the children of the day: we not are of the night: nor of darkness.

"and the"
Ps 27:1: A Psalm of David.>> The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom will I fear? the LORD is the strength of my life; of whom will I be afraid?
Ps 36:9: For with you is the fountain of life: in your light will we see light.
Ps 84:11: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will He withhold from them that walk uprightly.
Mal 4:2: But to you that fear my name will the Sun of righteousness arise with healing in his wings; and you will go forth: and grow up as calves of the stall.
Joh 1:4: 5: 9: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
Joh 8:12: Then spoke Jesus again to them: saying: I am the light of the world: He that'>He who follows me will not walk in darkness: but will have the light of life.
Joh 12:35: Then Jesus said to them: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while you have the light: lest darkness come upon you: for He that'>He who walks in darkness knows not whither He goeth.
2Ti 1:10: But is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ: who has abolished death: and has brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:

9 He who says he is in the light, and hates his brother, is in darkness even until now.1 John 2:9
Stats
Counts: 88 characters, 16 words, 68 letters, 24 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο λεγων εν τω φωτι ειναι και τον αδελφον αυτου μισων εν τη σκοτια εστιν εως αρτι

Lit: The one claiming in the light to be and the brother of him hating, in the darkness is even until now.

KJV: He that saith he is in the light, and hateth his brother, is in darkness even until now.
References

"that saith"
1Jo 2:4: He who says: I know him: and keeps not his commandments: is a liar: and the truth not is in him.

"he is"
1Jo 1:6: If we say that we have fellowship with him: and walk in darkness: we lie: and not do the truth:
Joh 9:41: Jesus said to them: If you were blind: you should have no sin: but now you say: We see; therefore your sin remaineth.
Ro 2:18-21: know his will: and approve the things that are more excellent: being instructed out of the law;

"and hateth"
1Jo 3:13-17: not Marvel: my brothers: if the world hate you.

"is in"
1Jo 2:11: But he who hates his brother is in darkness: and walks in darkness: and knows not whither he goes: because that darkness has blinded his eyes.
Ps 82:5: They not know: neither will they understand; they walk on in darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.
1Co 13:1-3: Though I speak with the tongues of men and of angels: and not have charity: I am become as sounding brass: or a tinkling cymbal.
2Pe 1:9: But he who lacks these things is blind: and cannot see afar off: and has forgotten that he was purged from his old sins.

 ο αγαπων τον αδελφον αυτου εν τω φωτι μενει και σκανδαλον εν αυτω ουκ εστιν

10 He who loves his brother abides in the light, and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.1 John 2:10
Stats
Rank: #3695 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 96 characters, 17 words, 77 letters, 28 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο αγαπων τον αδελφον αυτου εν τω φωτι μενει και σκανδαλον εν αυτω ουκ εστιν

Lit: The one loving the brother of him, in the light abides, and cause for stumbling in him not there is.

KJV: He that loveth his brother abideth in the light, and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.
References

"that loveth"
1Jo 3:14: We know that we have passed from death to life: because we love the brothers. He who loves not his brother abides in death.
Ho 6:3: Then will we know: if we follow on to know the LORD: His going forth is prepared as the morning; and He will come to us as the rain: as the latter and former rain to the earth.
Joh 8:31: Then said Jesus to those Jews which believed on Him: If you continue in my word: then are you my disciples indeed;
Ro 14:13: Let not us therefore judge one another any more: but judge this rather: that no man put a stumblingblock or an occasion to fall in his brother's way.
2Pe 1:10: For what reason the rather: brothers: give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if you do these things: you will never fall:

"occasion of stumbling"
Mt 13:21: Yet has not he root in himself: but endures for a while: for when tribulation or persecution arises because of the word: soon he is offended.
Mt 18:7: Woe to the world because of offences! for it must needs be that offences come; but woe to that man by whom the offence comes!
Lu 17:1: 2: Then said he to the disciples: It is impossible but that offences will come: but woe to him: through whom they come!
Ro 9:32: 33: For what reason? Because they sought it not by faith: but as it were by the works of the law. For they stumbled at that stumblingstone;
Php 1:10: That you may approve things that are excellent; that you may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ;

11 But he who hates his brother is in darkness, and walks in darkness, and knows not whither he goes, because that darkness has blinded his eyes.1 John 2:11
Stats
Rank: #4454 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 150 characters, 23 words, 121 letters, 40 vowels, 81 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο δε μισων τον αδελφον αυτου εν τη σκοτια εστιν και εν τη σκοτια περιπατει και ουκ οιδεν που υπαγει οτι η σκοτια ετυφλωσεν τους οφθαλμους αυτου

Lit: The one however hating the brother of him, in the darkness is, and in the darkness walks; and not does he know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded the eyes of him.

KJV: But he that hateth his brother is in darkness, and walketh in darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, because that darkness hath blinded his eyes.
References

"he that"
1Jo 2:9: He who says he is in the light: and hates his brother: is in darkness even until now.
Joh 12:35: Then Jesus said to them: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while you have the light: lest darkness come upon you: for He that'>He who walks in darkness knows not whither He goeth.
Tit 3:3: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish: disobedient: deceived: serving divers lusts and pleasures: living in malice and envy: hateful: and hating one another.

"and walketh"
Pr 4:19: The way of the wicked is as darkness: they not know at what they stumble.
Joh 12:35: Then Jesus said to them: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while you have the light: lest darkness come upon you: for He that'>He who walks in darkness knows not whither He goeth.

"because"
Joh 12:40: He has blinded their eyes: and hardened their heart; that they not should see with their eyes: nor understand with their heart: and be converted: and I should heal them.
2Co 3:14: But their minds were blinded: for until this day remains the same vail untaken away in the reading of the old testament; which vail is done away in Christ.
2Co 4:4: In whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of them which not believe: lest the light of the glorious gospel of Christ: who is the image of God: should shine to them.
Re 3:17: Because you say: I am rich: and increased with goods: and have need not ofhing; and know not that you are wretched: and miserable: and poor: and blind: and naked:

12 I write to you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.1 John 2:12
Stats
Rank: #3110 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 90 characters, 14 words, 71 letters, 31 vowels, 40 consonants
Translation
Greek: γραφω υμιν τεκνια οτι αφεωνται υμιν αι αμαρτιαι δια το ονομα αυτου

Lit: I am writing to you, little children, because have been forgiven your sins for the sake of the name of Him.

KJV: I write unto you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake.
References

"write"
1Jo 2:7: 13: 14: 21: Brothers: I write no new commandment to you: but an old commandment which you had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which you have heard from the beginning.
1Jo 1:4: These things write we to you: that your joy may be full.

"little"
1Jo 2:1: My little children: these things write I to you: that you not sin. And if any man sin: we have an advocate with the Father: Jesus Christ the righteous:

"your"
1Jo 1:7: 9: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
Ps 32:1: 2: A Psalm of David: Maschil.>> Blessed is he whose transgression is forgiven: whose sin is covered.
Lu 5:20: When he saw their faith: he said to him: Man: your sins are forgiven you.
Lu 7:47-50: For what reason I say to you: Her sins: which are many: are forgiven; for she loved much: but to whom little is forgiven: the same loves little.
Lu 24:47: That repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations: beginning at Jerusalem.
Ac 4:12: Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men: whereby we must be saved.
Ac 10:43: To him give all the prophets witness: that through his name whoever believes in him will receive remission of sins.
Ac 13:38: Be it known to you therefore: men and brothers: that through this man is preached to you the forgiveness of sins:
Ro 4:6: 7: Even as David also describes the blessedness of the man: to whom God imputes righteousness without works:
Eph 1:7: In whom we have redemption through his blood: the forgiveness of sins: according to the riches of his grace;
Col 1:14: In whom we have redemption through his blood: even the forgiveness of sins:

"for"
Ps 25:11: For your name's sake: O LORD: pardon my iniquity; for it is great.
Ps 106:8: Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake: that he might make his mighty power to be known.
Jer 14:7: O LORD: though our iniquities testify against us: do you it for your name's sake: for our backslidings are many; we have sinned against you.
Eph 4:32: Be you kind one to another: tenderhearted: forgiving one another: even as God for Christ's sake has forgiven you.

G4190πονηρόν.ponēron   (Adj-AMS)
G4190 πονηρός ponērós pon-ay-ros from a derivative of πόνος; hurtful, i.e. evil (properly, in effect or influence, and thus differing from κακός, which refers rather to essential character, as well as from σαπρός, which indicates degeneracy from original virtue); figuratively, calamitous; also (passively) ill, i.e. diseased; but especially (morally) culpable, i.e. derelict, vicious, facinorous; neuter (singular) mischief, malice, or (plural) guilt; masculine (singular) the devil, or (plural) sinners:--bad, evil, grievous, harm, lewd, malicious, wicked(-ness). See also πονηρότερος. 		πονηρόν.ponēron evil one. Adj-AMS
