G4106 πλάνη plánē plan-ay feminine of πλάνος (as abstractly); objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety:--deceit, to deceive, delusion, error. 		πλάνης.planēs of falsehood. N-GFS
6 We are of God: He that'>He who knows God hears'>hears us; He that'>He who not is of God hears'>hears not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.1 John 4:6
Stats
Counts: 145 characters, 27 words, 110 letters, 41 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Greek: ημεις εκ του θεου εσμεν ο γινωσκων τον θεον ακουει ημων ος ουκ εστιν εκ του θεου ουκ ακουει ημων εκ τουτου γινωσκομεν το πνευμα της αληθειας και το πνευμα της πλανης

Lit: We of God are. The one knowing God listens to us. He who not is from God, not listens to us. By this we know the Spirit of truth and the spirit of falsehood.

KJV: We are of God: he that knoweth God heareth us; he that is not of God heareth not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit of error.
References

"We are"
1Jo 4:4: You are of God: little children: and have overcome them: because greater is He that'>He who is in you: than He that'>He who is in the world.
Mic 3:8: But truly I am full of power by the spirit of the LORD: and of judgment: and of might: to declare to Jacob His transgression: and to Israel His sin.
Ro 1:1: Paul: a servant of Jesus Christ: called to be an apostle: separated to the gospel of God:
1Co 2:12-14: Now we have received: not the spirit of the world: but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.
2Pe 3:2: That you may be mindful of the words which were spoken before by the holy prophets: and of the commandment of us the apostles of the Lord and Saviour:
Jude 1:17: But: beloved: remember you the words which were spoken before of the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ;

"he that knoweth"
1Jo 4:8: He who loves not knows not God; for God is love.
Lu 10:22: All things are delivered to me of my Father: and no man knows who the Son is: but the Father; and who the Father is: but the Son: and He to whom the Son will reveal Him.
Joh 8:19: 45-50: Then said they to Him: Where is your Father? Jesus answered: You neither know me: nor my Father: if you had known me: you should have known my Father also.
Joh 10:27: My sheep hear my voice: and I know them: and they follow me:
Joh 13:20: Truly: truly: I say to you: He who receives'>receives'>receives'>receives whoever I send receives'>receives'>receives'>receives me; and he who receives'>receives'>receives'>receives me receives'>receives'>receives'>receives him that sent me.
Joh 18:37: Pilate therefore said to Him: Are you a king then? Jesus answered: You say that I am a king. To this end was I born: and for this cause came I into the world: that I should bear witness to the truth. Every one that is of the truth hears my voice.
Joh 20:21: Then said Jesus to them again: Peace be to you: as my Father has sent me: even so send I you.
1Co 14:37: If any man think Himself to be a prophet: or spiritual: let Him acknowledge that the things that I write to you are the commandments of the Lord.
2Co 10:7: Do you look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to Himself that He is Christ's: let Him of Himself think this again: that: as He is Christ's: even so are we Christ's.
2Th 1:8: In flaming fire taking vengeance on them that not know God: and that not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ:

"Hereby"
1Jo 4:1: Beloved: not believe every spirit: but try the spirits whether they are of God: because many false prophets are gone out into the world.
Isa 8:20: To the law and to the testimony: if they not speak according to this word: it is because there is no light in them.

"the spirit of truth"
Joh 14:17: Even the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive: because it sees Him not">not Him: neither knows Him: but you know Him; for He dwells with you: and will be in you.
Joh 15:26: But when the Comforter is come: whom I will send to you from the Father: even the Spirit of truth: which proceeds from the Father: He will testify of me:

"and"
Isa 29:10: For the LORD has poured out upon you the spirit of deep sleep: and has closed your eyes: the prophets and your rulers: the seers has He covered.
Ho 4:12: My people ask counsel at their stocks: and their staff declares to them: for the spirit of whoredoms has caused them to err: and they have gone a whoring from under their God.
Mic 2:11: If a man walking in the spirit and falsehood do lie: saying: I will prophesy to you of wine and of strong drink; he will even be the prophet of this people.
Ro 11:8: (According as it is written: God has given them the spirit of slumber: eyes that they not should see: and ears that they not should hear;) to this day.
2Th 2:9-11: Even him: whose coming is after the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders:

G2316 θεός theós theh-os of uncertain affinity; a deity, especially (with ὁ) the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very:--X exceeding, God, god(-ly, -ward). 		Θεόν.Theon God. N-AMS
7 Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loves is born of God, and knows God.1 John 4:7
Stats
Rank: #232 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 112 characters, 19 words, 85 letters, 34 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Greek: αγαπητοι αγαπωμεν αλληλους οτι η αγαπη εκ του θεου εστιν και πας ο αγαπων εκ του θεου γεγεννηται και γινωσκει τον θεον

Lit: Beloved, we should love one another, because love from God is; and everyone loving, from God has been born, and knows God.

KJV: Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loveth is born of God, and knoweth God.
References

"let"
1Jo 4:20: 21: If a man say: I love God: and hates His brother: He is a liar: for He that'>He who loves not His brother whom He has seen: how can He love God whom He has not seen?
1Jo 2:10: He who loves his brother abides in the light: and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.
1Jo 3:10-23: In this the children of God are manifest: and the children of the devil: whoever does not righteousness not is of God: neither He that'>He who loves not His brother.
1Jo 5:1: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loves'>loves Him that begot loves'>loves Him also that is begotten of Him.

"love is"
1Jo 4:8: He who loves not knows not God; for God is love.
De 30:6: The LORD your God will circumcise your heart: and the heart of your seed: to love the LORD your God with all your heart: and with all your soul: that you may live.
Ga 5:22: But the fruit of the Spirit is love: joy: peace: longsuffering: gentleness: goodness: faith:
1Th 4:9: 10: But as touching brotherly love you not need that I write to you: for you yourselves are taught of God to love one another.
2Ti 1:7: For God has not given us the spirit of fear; but of power: and of love: and of a sound mind.
1Pe 1:22: Seeing you have purified your souls in obeying the truth through the Spirit to unfeigned love of the brothers: see that you love one another with a pure heart fervently:

"every"
1Jo 4:12: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.
1Jo 2:29: If you know that he is righteous: you know that every one that does righteousness is born of him.
1Jo 3:14: We know that we have passed from death to life: because we love the brothers. He who loves not his brother abides in death.
1Jo 5:1: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loves'>loves Him that begot loves'>loves Him also that is begotten of Him.

"and knoweth"
Joh 17:3: This is life eternal: that they might know you the only true God: and Jesus Christ: whom you have sent.
2Co 4:6: For God: who commanded the light to shine out of darkness: has shined in our hearts: to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.
Ga 4:9: But now: after that you have known God: or rather are known of God: how turn you again to the weak and beggarly elements: to what you desire again to be in bondage?

 ο μη αγαπων ουκ εγνω τον θεον οτι ο θεος αγαπη εστιν
StrongsGreekEnglishMorphology
G3588ὁho   (Art-NMS)
G3588 ὁ ho to the definite article; the (sometimes to be supplied, at others omitted, in English idiom):--the, this, that, one, he, she, it, etc., 		ὁho The one Art-NMS
G3361μὴmē   (Adv)
G3361 μή mḗ may a primary particle of qualified negation (whereas οὐ expresses an absolute denial); (adverb) not, (conjunction) lest; also (as an interrogative implying a negative answer (whereas οὐ expects an affirmative one)) whether:--any but (that), X forbear, + God forbid, + lack, lest, neither, never, no (X wise in), none, nor, (can-)not, nothing, that not, un(-taken), without. Often used in compounds in substantially the same relations. See also ἐὰν μή, ἵνα μή, οὐ μή, μῆκος, μηκύνω, μήν, μὴ οὐκ., 		μὴmē not Adv

8 He who loves not knows not God; for God is love.1 John 4:8
Stats
Rank: #392 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 52 characters, 10 words, 40 letters, 14 vowels, 26 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο μη αγαπων ουκ εγνω τον θεον οτι ο θεος αγαπη εστιν

Lit: The one not loving, not has known God, because God love is.

KJV: He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love.
References

"knoweth"

1Jo 3:6: Whoever abides in him sins'>sins not: whoever sins'>sins has not seen him: neither known him.
Joh 8:54: 55: Jesus answered: If I honour myself: my honour not ishing: it is my Father that honours me; of whom you say: that He is your God:

"God is"
1Jo 1:5: This then is the message which we have heard of Him: and declare to you: that God is light: and in Him is no darkness at all.

Eph 2:4: But God: who is rich in mercy: for His great love wherewith He loved us:
Heb 12:29: For our God is a consuming fire.

9 In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent His only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through Him.1 John 4:9
Stats
Rank: #1103 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 141 characters, 25 words, 112 letters, 40 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν τουτω εφανερωθη η αγαπη του θεου εν ημιν οτι τον υιον αυτου τον μονογενη απεσταλκεν ο θεος εις τον κοσμον ινα ζησωμεν δι αυτου

Lit: In this has been revealed the love of God among us, that the Son of Him, the one and only, has sent God into the world, so that we might live through Him.

KJV: In this was manifested the love of God toward us, because that God sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him.
References

"was"
1Jo 3:16: Hereby perceive we the love of God: because He laid down His life for us: and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.
Joh 3:16: For God so loved the world: that He gave His only begotten Son: that whoever believes in Him not should perish: but have everlasting life.
Ro 5:8-10: But God commends His love toward us: in that: while we were yet sinners: Christ died for us.
Ro 8:32: He who not spared His own Son: but delivered Him up for us all: how will He not">not He with Him also freely give us all things?

"God sent"
1Jo 4:10: Herein is love: not that we loved God: but that He loved us: and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
Lu 4:18: The Spirit of the Lord is upon me: because He has anointed me to preach the gospel to the poor; He has sent me to heal the brokenhearted: to preach deliverance to the captives: and recovering of sight to the blind: to set at liberty them that are bruised:
Joh 5:23: That all men should honour the Son: even as they honour the Father. He who honours'>honours not the Son honours'>honours not the Father which has sent Him.
Joh 6:29: Jesus answered and said to them: This is the work of God: that you believe on Him whom He has sent.
Joh 8:29: 42: He that'>He who sent me is with me: the Father has not left me alone; for I do always those things that please Him.

"only"
Ps 2:7: I will declare the decree: the LORD has said to me: You are my Son; this day have I begotten you.
Mr 12:6: Having yet therefore one son: his wellbeloved: he sent him also last to them: saying: They will reverence my son.
Joh 1:14-18: The Word was made flesh: and dwelt among us: (and we beheld His glory: the glory as of the only begotten of the Father: ) full of grace and truth.
Joh 3:18: He who believes'>believes on Him not is condemned: but He that'>He who believes'>believes not is condemned already: because He has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
Heb 1:5: For to which of the angels said He at any time: You are my Son: this day have I begotten you? And again: I will be to Him a Father: and He will be to me a Son?

"we"
1Jo 5:11: This is the record: that God has given to us eternal life: and this life is in His Son.
Joh 6:51: 57: I am the living bread which came down from heaven: if any man eat of this bread: he will live for ever: and the bread that I will give is my flesh: which I will give for the life of the world.
Joh 10:10: 28-30: The thief comes not: but for to steal: and to kill: and to destroy: I am come that they might have life: and that they might have it more abundantly.
Joh 11:25: 26: Jesus said to her: I am the resurrection: and the life: He that'>He who believes in me: though He were dead: yet will He live:
Joh 14:6: Jesus says to Him: I am the way: the truth: and the life: no man comes to the Father: but by me.
Col 3:3: 4: For you are dead: and your life is hid with Christ in God.

G4012περὶperi   (Prep)
G4012 περί perí per-ee from the base of πέραν; properly, through (all over), i.e. around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time (with the genitive case denoting the subject or occasion or superlative point; with the accusative case the locality, circuit, matter, circumstance or general period):--(there-)about, above, against, at, on behalf of, X and his company, which concern, (as) concerning, for, X how it will go with, ((there-, where-)) of, on, over, pertaining (to), for sake, X (e-)state, (as) touching, (where-)by (in), with. In comparative, it retains substantially the same meaning of circuit (around), excess (beyond), or completeness (through). 		περὶperi for Prep

10 Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that He loved us, and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins.1 John 4:10
Stats
Rank: #906 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 114 characters, 21 words, 87 letters, 35 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν τουτω εστιν η αγαπη ουχ οτι ημεις ηγαπησαμεν τον θεον αλλ οτι αυτος ηγαπησεν ημας και απεστειλεν τον υιον αυτου ιλασμον περι των αμαρτιων ημων

Lit: In this is love, not that we loved God, but that He loved us and sent the Son of Him as a propitiation for the sins of us.

KJV: Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
References

"Herein"
1Jo 4:8: 9: He who loves not knows not God; for God is love.
1Jo 3:1: Look: what manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us: that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knows not us: because it knew Him not">not Him.

"not"
1Jo 4:19: We love him: because he first loved us.
De 7:7: 8: The LORD not did set His love upon you: nor choose you: because you were more in number than any people; for you were the few of all people:
Joh 15:16: You not have chosen me: but I have chosen you: and ordained you: that you should go and bring forth fruit: and that your fruit should remain: that whatever you will ask of the Father in my name: He may give it you.
Ro 5:8-10: But God commends His love toward us: in that: while we were yet sinners: Christ died for us.
Ro 8:29: 30: For whom He did foreknow: He also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of His Son: that He might be the firstborn among many brothers.
2Co 5:19-21: To wit: that God was in Christ: reconciling the world to Himself: not imputing their trespasses to them; and has committed to us the word of reconciliation.
Eph 2:4: 5: But God: who is rich in mercy: for His great love wherewith He loved us:
Tit 3:3-5: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish: disobedient: deceived: serving divers lusts and pleasures: living in malice and envy: hateful: and hating one another.

"and sent"
1Jo 2:2: He is the propitiation for our sins: not and for ours only: but also for the sins of the whole world.
Da 9:24: 70 weeks are determined upon your people and upon your holy city: to finish the transgression: and to make an end of sins: and to make reconciliation for iniquity: and to bring in everlasting righteousness: and to seal up the vision and prophecy: and to anoint the most Holy.
Ro 3:25: 26: Whom God has set forth to be a propitiation through faith in His blood: to declare His righteousness for the remission of sins that are past: through the forbearance of God;
1Pe 2:24: Who his own self bare our sins in his own body on the tree: that we: being dead to sins: should live to righteousness: by whose stripes you were healed.
1Pe 3:18: For Christ also has once suffered for sins: the just for the unjust: that He might bring us to God: being put to death in the flesh: but quickened by the Spirit:

11 Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.1 John 4:11
Stats
Counts: 63 characters, 11 words, 48 letters, 22 vowels, 26 consonants
Translation
Greek: αγαπητοι ει ουτως ο θεος ηγαπησεν ημας και ημεις οφειλομεν αλληλους αγαπαν

Lit: Beloved, if so God loved us, also we ought one another to love.

KJV: Beloved, if God so loved us, we ought also to love one another.
References

Lu 10:37: He said: He who showed mercy on Him. Then said Jesus to Him: Go: and do you likewise.

Eph 5:1: 2: Be you therefore followers of God: as dear children;
Col 3:13: Forbearing one another: and forgiving one another: if any man have a quarrel against any: even as Christ forgave you: so also do you.

12 No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another, God dwells in us, and His love is perfected in us.1 John 4:12
Stats
Rank: #3074 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 110 characters, 21 words, 83 letters, 34 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Greek: θεον ουδεις πωποτε τεθεαται εαν αγαπωμεν αλληλους ο θεος εν ημιν μενει και η αγαπη αυτου τετελειωμενη εστιν εν ημιν

Lit: God no one at any time has seen; if we should love one another, God in us abides and the love of Him having been perfected in us is.

KJV: No man hath seen God at any time. If we love one another, God dwelleth in us, and his love is perfected in us.
References

"seen"
1Jo 4:20: If a man say: I love God: and hates His brother: He is a liar: for He that'>He who loves not His brother whom He has seen: how can He love God whom He has not seen?
Ge 32:30: Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face: and my life is preserved.
Ex 33:20: He said: You not canst see my face: for there will no man see me: and live.
Nu 12:8: With Him will I speak mouth to mouth: even apparently: not and in dark speeches; and the similitude of the LORD will He look: for what reason then were you not afraid to speak against my servant Moses?
Joh 1:18: No man has seen God at any time; the only begotten Son: which is in the bosom of the Father: He has declared Him.
1Ti 1:17: Now to the King eternal: immortal: invisible: the only wise God: be honour and glory for ever and ever. Amen.
1Ti 6:16: Who only has immortality: dwelling in the light which no man can approach to; whom no man has seen: nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. Amen.
Heb 11:27: By faith he forsook Egypt: not fearing the wrath of the king: for he endured: as seeing him who is invisible.

"love one"
1Jo 4:6: We are of God: He that'>He who knows God hears'>hears us; He that'>He who not is of God hears'>hears not us. Hereby know we the spirit of truth: and the spirit of error.
1Jo 3:24: He that'>He who keeps His commandments dwells in Him: and He in Him. And hereby we know that He abides in us: by the Spirit which He has given us.

"and his"
1Jo 4:17: 18: Herein is our love made perfect: that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is: so are we in this world.
1Jo 2:5: But whoever keeps His word: in Him truly is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in Him.
1Co 13:13: Now abides faith: hope: charity: these 3; but the great of these is charity.

G4151 πνεῦμα pneûma pnyoo-mah from πνέω; a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christs spirit, the Holy Spirit:--ghost, life, spirit(-ual, -ually), mind. 13 Hereby know we that we dwell in Him, and He in us, because He has given us of His Spirit.1 John 4:13
Stats
Rank: #3259 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 90 characters, 18 words, 68 letters, 26 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν τουτω γινωσκομεν οτι εν αυτω μενομεν και αυτος εν ημιν οτι εκ του πνευματος αυτου δεδωκεν ημιν

Lit: By this we know that in Him we abide, and He in us, because from out the Spirit of Him He has given to us.

KJV: Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his Spirit.
References

"Hereby know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, because he hath given us of his Spirit."
1Jo 4:15: 16: Whoever will confess that Jesus is the Son of God: God dwells in Him: and He in God.
1Jo 3:24: He that'>He who keeps His commandments dwells in Him: and He in Him. And hereby we know that He abides in us: by the Spirit which He has given us.
Joh 14:20-26: At that day you will know that I am in my Father: and you in me: and I in you.
Ro 8:9-17: But you not are in the flesh: but in the Spirit: if so be that the Spirit of God dwell in you. Now if any man not have the Spirit of Christ: He is none of His.
1Co 2:12: Now we have received: not the spirit of the world: but the spirit which is of God; that we might know the things that are freely given to us of God.
1Co 3:16: 17: Know you not that you are the temple of God: and that the Spirit of God dwells in you?
1Co 6:19: What? know you not that your body is the temple of the Holy Ghost which is in you: which you have of God: and you not are your own?
Ga 5:22-25: But the fruit of the Spirit is love: joy: peace: longsuffering: gentleness: goodness: faith:
Eph 2:20-22: Are built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets: Jesus Christ Himself being the chief corner stone;

14 We have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.1 John 4:14
Stats
Rank: #3279 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 92 characters, 20 words, 72 letters, 27 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Greek: και ημεις τεθεαμεθα και μαρτυρουμεν οτι ο πατηρ απεσταλκεν τον υιον σωτηρα του κοσμου

Lit: And we have seen and testify that the Father has sent the Son as Savior of the world.

KJV: And we have seen and do testify that the Father sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.
References

"we have"
1Jo 1:1-3: That which was from the beginning: which we have heard: which we have seen with our eyes: which we have looked upon: and our hands have handled: of the Word of life;
1Jo 5:9: If we receive the witness of men: the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which He has testified of His Son.
Joh 1:14: The Word was made flesh: and dwelt among us: (and we beheld His glory: the glory as of the only begotten of the Father: ) full of grace and truth.
Joh 3:11: 32: Truly: truly: I say to you: We speak that we do know: and testify that we have seen; and you not receive our witness.
Joh 5:39: Search the scriptures; for in them you think you have eternal life: and they are they which testify of me.
Joh 15:26: 27: But when the Comforter is come: whom I will send to you from the Father: even the Spirit of truth: which proceeds from the Father: He will testify of me:
Ac 18:5: When Silas and Timotheus were come from Macedonia: Paul was pressed in the spirit: and testified to the Jews that Jesus was Christ.
1Pe 5:12: By Silvanus: a faithful brother to you: as I suppose: I have written briefly: exhorting: and testifying that this is the true grace of God wherein you stand.

"the Father"
1Jo 4:10: Herein is love: not that we loved God: but that He loved us: and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
Joh 3:34: For He whom God has sent speaks the words of God: for God gives not the Spirit by measure to Him.
Joh 5:36: 37: But I have greater witness than that of John: for the works which the Father has given me to finish: the same works that I do: bear witness of me: that the Father has sent me.
Joh 10:36: Say you of Him: whom the Father has sanctified: and sent into the world: You blaspheme; because I said: I am the Son of God?

"the Saviour"
1Jo 2:1: 2: My little children: these things write I to you: that you not sin. And if any man sin: we have an advocate with the Father: Jesus Christ the righteous:
Joh 1:29: The next day John sees Jesus coming to Him: and says: Look the Lamb of God: which takes away the sin of the world.
Joh 3:16: 17: For God so loved the world: that He gave His only begotten Son: that whoever believes in Him not should perish: but have everlasting life.
Joh 4:42: Said to the woman: Now we believe: not because of your saying: for we have heard Him ourselves: and know that this is indeed the Christ: the Saviour of the world.
Joh 12:47: If any man hear my words: and not believe: I judge not him: for I not came to judge the world: but to save the world.

15 Whoever will confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwells in Him, and He in God.1 John 4:15
Stats
Counts: 89 characters, 16 words, 69 letters, 24 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Greek: ος αν ομολογηση οτι ιησους εστιν ο υιος του θεου ο θεος εν αυτω μενει και αυτος εν τω θεω

Lit: Whoever if shall confess that Jesus Christ is the Son of God, God in him abides, and he in God.

KJV: Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God dwelleth in him, and he in God.
References

"confess"
1Jo 4:2: Hereby know you the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesss that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:
1Jo 5:1: 5: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loves'>loves Him that begot loves'>loves Him also that is begotten of Him.
Mt 10:32: Whoever therefore will confess me before men: Him will I confess also before my Father which is in heaven.
Lu 12:8: Also I say to you: Whoever will confess me before men: Him will the Son of man also confess before the angels of God:
Ro 10:9: That if you will confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus: and will believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead: you will be saved.
Php 2:11: that every tongue should confess that Jesus Christ is Lord: to the glory of God the Father.
2Jo 1:7: For many deceivers are entered into the world: who not confess that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh. This is a deceiver and an antichrist.

"God dwelleth"
1Jo 4:12: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.
1Jo 3:24: He that'>He who keeps His commandments dwells in Him: and He in Him. And hereby we know that He abides in us: by the Spirit which He has given us.

16 We have known and believed the love that God has to us. God is love; and He that'>He who dwells'>dwells in love dwells'>dwells in God, and God in Him.1 John 4:16
Stats
Rank: #676 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 135 characters, 26 words, 103 letters, 38 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Greek: και ημεις εγνωκαμεν και πεπιστευκαμεν την αγαπην ην εχει ο θεος εν ημιν ο θεος αγαπη εστιν και ο μενων εν τη αγαπη εν τω θεω μενει και ο θεος εν αυτω

Lit: And we have come to know and have come to believe the love that has God as to us. God love is, and the one abiding in love, in God abides, and God in him abides.

KJV: And we have known and believed the love that God hath to us. God is love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in God, and God in him.
References

"we"
1Jo 4:9: 10: In this was manifested the love of God toward us: because that God sent His only begotten Son into the world: that we might live through Him.
1Jo 3:1: 16: Look: what manner of love the Father has bestowed upon us: that we should be called the sons of God: therefore the world knows not us: because it knew Him not">not Him.
Ps 18:1-3: A Psalm of David: the servant of the LORD: who spoke to the LORD the words of this song in the day that the LORD delivered Him from the hand of all His enemies: and from the hand of Saul: And He said: >> I will love you: O LORD: my strength.
Ps 31:19: Oh how great is your goodness: which you have laid up for them that fear you; which you have wrought for them that trust in you before the sons of men!
Ps 36:7-9: How excellent is your lovingkindness: O God! therefore the children of men put their trust under the shadow of your wings.
Isa 64:4: For since the beginning of the world men not have heard: nor perceived by the ear: neither has the eye seen: O God: beside you: what He has prepared for Him that waits for Him.
1Co 2:9: But as it is written: Eye has not seen: nor ear heard: neither have entered into the heart of man: the things which God has prepared for them that love Him.

"God is love"
1Jo 4:8: 12: 13: He who loves not knows not God; for God is love.

"and he"
1Jo 4:12: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.
1Jo 3:24: He that'>He who keeps His commandments dwells in Him: and He in Him. And hereby we know that He abides in us: by the Spirit which He has given us.

G3326μεθ’meth’   (Prep)
G3326 μετά metá met-ah a primary preposition (often used adverbially); properly, denoting accompaniment; amid (local or causal); modified variously according to the case (genitive association, or accusative succession) with which it is joined; occupying an intermediate position between ἀπό or ἐκ and εἰς or πρός; less intimate than ἐν and less close than σύν):--after(-ward), X that he again, against, among, X and, + follow, hence, hereafter, in, of, (up-)on, + our, X and setting, since, (un-)to, + together, when, with (+ -out). Often used in composition, in substantially the same relations of participation or proximity, and transfer or sequence. 		μεθ’meth’ with Prep

G2250ἡμέρᾳhēmera   (N-DFS)
G2250 ἡμέρα hēméra hay-mer-ah feminine (with ὥρα implied) of a derivative of (to sit; akin to the base of ἑδραῖος) meaning tame, i.e. gentle; day, i.e. (literally) the time space between dawn and dark, or the whole 24 hours (but several days were usually reckoned by the Jews as inclusive of the parts of both extremes); figuratively, a period (always defined more or less clearly by the context):--age, + alway, (mid-)day (by day, (-ly)), + for ever, judgment, (day) time, while, years. 		ἡμέρᾳhēmera day N-DFS

17 Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.1 John 4:17
Stats
Counts: 125 characters, 23 words, 96 letters, 39 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν τουτω τετελειωται η αγαπη μεθ ημων ινα παρρησιαν εχωμεν εν τη ημερα της κρισεως οτι καθως εκεινος εστιν και ημεις εσμεν εν τω κοσμω τουτω

Lit: In this has been perfected love with us, so that confidence we may have in the day of judgment, that just as He is, also we are in the world this.

KJV: Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.
References

"made"
1Jo 4:12: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.
1Jo 2:5: But whoever keeps His word: in Him truly is the love of God perfected: hereby know we that we are in Him.
Jas 2:22: See you how faith wrought with his works: and by works was faith made perfect?

"we may"
1Jo 2:28: Now: little children: abide in him; that: when he will appear: we may have confidence: not and be ashamed before him at his coming.
1Jo 3:19-21: Hereby we know that we are of the truth: and will assure our hearts before him.
Jas 2:13: For he will have judgment without mercy: that has showed no mercy; and mercy rejoices against judgment.

"the day"
Mt 10:15: Truly I say to you: It will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment: than for that city.
Mt 11:22: 24: But I say to you: It will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon at the day of judgment: than for you.
Mt 12:36: But I say to you: That every idle word that men will speak: they will give account thereof in the day of judgment.
2Pe 2:9: The Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptations: and to reserve the unjust to the day of judgment to be punished:
2Pe 3:7: But the heavens and the earth: which are now: by the same word are kept in store: reserved to fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.

"as"
1Jo 3:3: Every man that has this hope in him purifies himself: even as he is pure.
Mt 10:25: It is enough for the disciple that he be as his master: and the servant as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub: how much more will they call them of his household?
Joh 15:20: Remember the word that I said to you: The servant not is greater than his lord. If they have persecuted me: they will also persecute you; if they have kept my saying: they will keep yours also.
Ro 8:29: For whom He did foreknow: He also did predestinate to be conformed to the image of His Son: that He might be the firstborn among many brothers.
Heb 12:2: 3: Looking to Jesus the author and finisher of our faith; who for the joy that was set before Him endured the cross: despising the shame: and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God.
1Pe 3:16-18: Having a good conscience; that: whereas they speak evil of you: as of evildoers: they may be ashamed that falsely accuse your good conversation in Christ.

18 There is no fear in love; but perfect love casts out fear: because fear has torment. He who fears not is made perfect in love.1 John 4:18
Stats
Rank: #772 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 132 characters, 22 words, 104 letters, 43 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Greek: φοβος ουκ εστιν εν τη αγαπη αλλ η τελεια αγαπη εξω βαλλει τον φοβον οτι ο φοβος κολασιν εχει ο δε φοβουμενος ου τετελειωται εν τη αγαπη

Lit: Fear no there is in love, but perfect love out casts fear, because the fear punishment has; the one now fearing, not has been perfected in love.

KJV: There is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear: because fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in love.
References

"is no"
Lu 1:74: 75: That he would grant to us: that we being delivered out of the hand of our enemies might serve him without fear:
Ro 8:15: For you not have received the spirit of bondage again to fear; but you have received the Spirit of adoption: whereby we cry: Abba: Father.
2Ti 1:7: For God has not given us the spirit of fear; but of power: and of love: and of a sound mind.
Heb 12:28: For what reason we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved: let us have grace: whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

"fear hath"
Job 15:21: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer will come upon him.
Ps 73:19: How are they brought into desolation: as in a moment! they are utterly consumed with terrors.
Ps 88:15: 16: I am afflicted and ready to die from my youth up: while I suffer your terrors I am distracted.
Ps 119:120: My flesh trembles for fear of you; and I am afraid of your judgments.
Jas 2:19: You believe that there is one God; you do well: the devils also believe: and tremble.

"He that"
1Jo 4:12: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.

20 If a man say, I love God, and hates His brother, He is a liar: for He that'>He who loves not His brother whom He has seen, how can He love God whom He has not seen?1 John 4:20
Stats
Rank: #2072 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 160 characters, 31 words, 119 letters, 45 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Greek: εαν τις ειπη οτι αγαπω τον θεον και τον αδελφον αυτου μιση ψευστης εστιν ο γαρ μη αγαπων τον αδελφον αυτου ον εωρακεν τον θεον ον ουχ εωρακεν πως δυναται αγαπαν

Lit: If anyone should say - , I love God, and the brother of him should hate, a liar he is. The one for not loving the brother of him, whom he has seen, God, whom not he has seen, not is he able to love.

KJV: If a man say, I love God, and hateth his brother, he is a liar: for he that loveth not his brother whom he hath seen, how can he love God whom he hath not seen?
References

"a man"
1Jo 2:4: He who says: I know him: and keeps not his commandments: is a liar: and the truth not is in him.
1Jo 3:17: But whoever has this world's good: and sees His brother have need: and shuts up His bowels of compassion from Him: how dwells the love of God in Him?

"not"
1Jo 4:12: No man has seen God at any time. If we love one another: God dwells in us: and His love is perfected in us.

21 This commandment have we from Him, That He who loves God love His brother also.1 John 4:21
Stats
Rank: #6065 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 84 characters, 15 words, 67 letters, 23 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Greek: και ταυτην την εντολην εχομεν απ αυτου ινα ο αγαπων τον θεον αγαπα και τον αδελφον αυτου

Lit: And this the commandment we have from Him, that the one loving God should love also the brother of him.

KJV: And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his brother also.
References

"And this commandment have we from him, That he who loveth God love his brother also."
1Jo 4:11: Beloved: if God so loved us: we ought also to love one another.
1Jo 3:11: 14: 18: 23: For this is the message that you heard from the beginning: that we should love one another.
Le 19:18: You will not avenge: nor bear any grudge against the children of your people: but you will love your neighbour as yourself: I am the LORD.
Mt 22:37-39: Jesus said to Him: You will love the Lord your God with all your heart: and with all your soul: and with all your mind.
Mr 12:29-33: Jesus answered Him: The first of all the commandments is: Hear: O Israel; The Lord our God is one Lord:
Lu 10:37: He said: He who showed mercy on Him. Then said Jesus to Him: Go: and do you likewise.
Joh 13:34: 35: A new commandment I give to you: That you love one another; as I have loved you: that you also love one another.
Joh 15:12: This is my commandment: That you love one another: as I have loved you.
Ro 12:9: 10: Let love be without dissimulation. Abhor that which is evil; cleave to that which is good.
Ro 13:9: 10: For this: You will not commit adultery: You will not kill: You will not steal: You will not bear false witness: You will not covet; and if there be any other commandment: it is briefly comprehended in this saying: namely: You will love your neighbour as yourself.
Ga 5:6: 14: For in Jesus Christ neither circumcision availeth any thing: nor uncircumcision; but faith which works by love.
1Th 4:9: But as touching brotherly love you not need that I write to you: for you yourselves are taught of God to love one another.
1Pe 3:8: Finally: be you all of one mind: having compassion one of another: love as brothers: be pitiful: be courteous:
1Pe 4:8: Above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity will cover the multitude of sins.

5
The Fourth Test of Fellowship

Understanding Christ’s Victory

1 <a class='u' title='Whosoever'>Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loves'>loves Him that begot loves'>loves Him also that is begotten of Him.1 John 5:1
Stats
Rank: #860 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 142 characters, 26 words, 114 letters, 42 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Greek: πας ο πιστευων οτι ιησους εστιν ο χριστος εκ του θεου γεγεννηται και πας ο αγαπων τον γεννησαντα αγαπα και τον γεγεννημενον εξ αυτου

Lit: Everyone believing that Jesus is the Christ, of God has been born, and everyone loving the One having begotten Him, loves also the one having been begotten from Him.

KJV: Whosoever believeth that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten of him.
References

"believeth"
1Jo 2:22: 23: Who is a liar but He that'>He who denies'>denies that Jesus is the Christ? He is antichrist: that denies'>denies the Father and the Son.
1Jo 4:2: 14: 15: Hereby know you the Spirit of God: Every spirit that confesss that Jesus Christ is come in the flesh is of God:
Mt 16:16: Simon Peter answered and said: You are the Christ: the Son of the living God.
Joh 1:12: 13: But as many as received Him: to them gave He power to become the sons of God: even to them that believe on His name:
Joh 6:69: We believe and are sure that you are that Christ: the Son of the living God.
Ac 8:37: Philip said: If you believe with all your heart: you may. And He answered and said: I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
Ro 10:9: 10: That if you will confess with your mouth the Lord Jesus: and will believe in your heart that God has raised Him from the dead: you will be saved.

"is born"
1Jo 5:4: For whatever is born of God overcomes'>overcomes the world: and this is the victory that overcomes'>overcomes the world: even our faith.
1Jo 2:29: If you know that he is righteous: you know that every one that does righteousness is born of him.
1Jo 3:9: Whoever is born of God does not commit sin; for His seed remains in Him: and He cannot sin: because He is born of God.
1Jo 4:7: Beloved: let us love one another: for love is of God; and every one that loves is born of God: and knows God.

"and every"
1Jo 2:10: He who loves his brother abides in the light: and there is none occasion of stumbling in him.
1Jo 3:14: 17: We know that we have passed from death to life: because we love the brothers. He who loves not his brother abides in death.
1Jo 4:20: If a man say: I love God: and hates His brother: He is a liar: for He that'>He who loves not His brother whom He has seen: how can He love God whom He has not seen?
Joh 15:23: He who hates'>hates me hates'>hates my Father also.
Jas 1:18: Of his own will begot he us with the word of truth: that we should be a kind of firstfruits of his creatures.
1Pe 1:3: 22: 23: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ: which according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again to a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead:

2 By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, and keep His commandments.1 John 5:2
Stats
Counts: 94 characters, 17 words, 73 letters, 24 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Greek: εν τουτω γινωσκομεν οτι αγαπωμεν τα τεκνα του θεου οταν τον θεον αγαπωμεν και τας εντολας αυτου τηρωμεν

Lit: By this we know that we love the children of God, when God we love and the commandments of Him keep.

KJV: By this we know that we love the children of God, when we love God, and keep his commandments.

G5083τηρῶμεν·tērōmen   (V-PSA-1P)
G5083 τηρέω tēréō tay-reh-o from (a watch; perhaps akin to θεωρέω); to guard (from loss or injury, properly, by keeping the eye upon; and thus differing from φυλάσσω, which is properly to prevent escaping; and from κουστωδία, which implies a fortress or full military lines of apparatus), i.e. to note (a prophecy; figuratively, to fulfil a command); by implication, to detain (in custody; figuratively, to maintain); by extension, to withhold (for personal ends; figuratively, to keep unmarried); by extension, to withhold (for personal ends; figuratively, to keep unmarried):--hold fast, keep(- er), (pre-, re-)serve, watch. 		τηρῶμεν·tērōmen we should keep; V-PSA-1P

3 For this is the love of God, that we keep His commandments: and His commandments not are grievous.1 John 5:3
Stats
Rank: #1290 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 98 characters, 16 words, 78 letters, 28 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Greek: αυτη γαρ εστιν η αγαπη του θεου ινα τας εντολας αυτου τηρωμεν και αι εντολαι αυτου βαρειαι ουκ εισιν

Lit: This for is the love of God, that the commandments of Him we should keep; and the commandments of Him burdensome not are.

KJV: For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments: and his commandments are not grievous.
References

"this"
Ex 20:6: Shewing mercy to thousands of them that love me: and keep my commandments.
De 5:10: Shewing mercy to thousands of them that love me and keep my commandments.
De 7:9: Know therefore that the LORD your God: He is God: the faithful God: which keeps covenant and mercy with them that love Him and keep His commandments to a000 generations;
De 10:12: 13: Now: Israel: what does the LORD your God require of you: but to fear the LORD your God: to walk in all His ways: and to love Him: and to serve the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul:
Da 9:4: I prayed to the LORD my God: and made my confession: and said: O Lord: the great and dreadful God: keeping the covenant and mercy to them that love Him: and to them that keep His commandments;
Mt 12:47-50: Then one said to him: Look: your mother and your brothers stand without: desiring to speak with you.
Joh 14:15: If you love me: keep my commandments.
Joh 14:21-24: He who has my commandments: and keeps them: He it is that loves'>loves me: and He that'>He who loves'>loves me will be loved of my Father: and I will love Him: and will manifest myself to Him.
Joh 15:10: 14: If you keep my commandments: you will abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments: and abide in His love.
2Jo 1:6: This is love: that we walk after his commandments. This is the commandment: That: as you have heard from the beginning: you should walk in it.

"and"
Ps 19:7-11: The law of the LORD is perfect: converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure: making wise the simple.
Ps 119:45: 47: 48: 103: 104: 127: 128: 140: I will walk at liberty: for I seek your precepts.
Pr 3:17: Her ways are ways of pleasantness: and all her paths are peace.
Mic 6:8: He has showed you: O man: what is good; and what does the LORD require of you: but to do justly: and to love mercy: and to walk humbly with your God?
Mt 11:28-30: Come to me: all you that labour and are heavy laden: and I will give you rest.
Ro 7:12: 22: For what reason the law is holy: and the commandment holy: and just: and good.

4 For whatever is born of God overcomes'>overcomes the world: and this is the victory that overcomes'>overcomes the world, even our faith.1 John 5:4
Stats
Rank: #988 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 118 characters, 19 words, 95 letters, 34 vowels, 61 consonants
Translation
Greek: οτι παν το γεγεννημενον εκ του θεου νικα τον κοσμον και αυτη εστιν η νικη η νικησασα τον κοσμον η πιστις ημων

Lit: For everyone having been born of God overcomes the world; and this is the victory having overcome the world: the faith of us.

KJV: For whatsoever is born of God overcometh the world: and this is the victory that overcometh the world, even our faith.
References

"whatsoever"
1Jo 5:1: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loves'>loves Him that begot loves'>loves Him also that is begotten of Him.
1Jo 3:9: Whoever is born of God does not commit sin; for His seed remains in Him: and He cannot sin: because He is born of God.

"overcometh"
1Jo 5:5: Who is He that'>He who overcomes the world: but He that'>He who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?
1Jo 2:13-17: I write to you: fathers: because you have known Him that is from the beginning. I write to you: young men: because you have overcome the wicked one. I write to you: little children: because you have known the Father.
1Jo 4:4: You are of God: little children: and have overcome them: because greater is He that'>He who is in you: than He that'>He who is in the world.
Joh 16:33: These things I have spoken to you: that in me you might have peace. In the world you will have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
Ro 8:35-37: Who will separate us from the love of Christ? will tribulation: or distress: or persecution: or famine: or nakedness: or peril: or sword?
1Co 15:57: But thanks be to God: which gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
Re 2:7: 11: 17: 26: He who has an ear: let Him hear what the Spirit says to the churches; To Him that overcomes will I give to eat of the tree of life: which is in the middle of the paradise of God.
Re 3:5: 12: 21: He who overcomes: the same will be clothed in white clothing; and I not will blot out His name out of the book of life: but I will confess His name before my Father: and before His angels.
Re 12:11: They overcame him by the blood of the Lamb: and by the word of their testimony; and they not loved their lives to the death.
Re 15:2: I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire: and them that had gotten the victory over the beast: and over His image: and over His mark: and over the number of His name: stand on the sea of glass: having the harps of God.

5 Who is He that'>He who overcomes the world, but He that'>He who believes that Jesus is the Son of God?1 John 5:5
Stats
Rank: #6350 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 88 characters, 17 words, 69 letters, 25 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Greek: τις εστιν ο νικων τον κοσμον ει μη ο πιστευων οτι ιησους εστιν ο υιος του θεου

Lit: Who now is the one overcoming the world, if not the one believing that Jesus is the Son of God?

KJV: Who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that Jesus is the Son of God?

"but"

G1223 διά diá dee-ah a primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through (in very wide applications, local, causal, or occasional):--after, always, among, at, to avoid, because of (that), briefly, by, for (cause) … fore, from, in, by occasion of, of, by reason of, for sake, that, thereby, therefore, X though, through(-out), to, wherefore, with (-in). G4151ΠνεῦμάPneuma   (N-NNS)
G4151 πνεῦμα pneûma pnyoo-mah from πνέω; a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christs spirit, the Holy Spirit:--ghost, life, spirit(-ual, -ually), mind. 6 This is He that'>He who came by water and blood, even Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that bears witness, because the Spirit is truth.1 John 5:6
Stats
Counts: 174 characters, 29 words, 135 letters, 47 vowels, 88 consonants
Translation
Greek: ουτος εστιν ο ελθων δι υδατος και αιματος ιησους ο χριστος ουκ εν τω υδατι μονον αλλ εν τω υδατι και τω αιματι και το πνευμα εστιν το μαρτυρουν οτι το πνευμα εστιν η αληθεια

Lit: This is the One having come by water and blood, Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and by blood. And the Spirit is the One testifying, because the Spirit is the truth.

KJV: This is he that came by water and blood, even Jesus Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that beareth witness, because the Spirit is truth.
References

"is he"
Joh 19:34: 35: But one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side: and forthwith came there out blood and water.

"by water and"
Isa 45:3: 4: I will give you the treasures of darkness: and hidden riches of secret places: that you may know that I: the LORD: which call you by your name: am the God of Israel.
Eze 36:25: Then will I sprinkle clean water upon you: and you will be clean: from all your filthiness: and from all your idols: will I cleanse you.
Joh 1:31-33: I knew not him: but that he should be made manifest to Israel: therefore am I come baptizing with water.
Joh 3:5: Jesus answered: Truly: truly: I say to you: Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit: He cannot enter into the kingdom of God.
Joh 4:10: 14: Jesus answered and said to her: If you knew the gift of God: and who it is that says to you: Give me to drink; you would have asked of Him: and He would have given you living water.
Joh 7:38: 39: He who believes on me: as the scripture has said: out of his belly will flow rivers of living water.
Ac 8:36: As they went on their way: they came to a certain water: and the eunuch said: See: here is water; what does hinder me to be baptized?
Eph 5:25-27: Husbands: love your wives: even as Christ also loved the church: and gave Himself for it;
Tit 3:5: Not by works of righteousness which we have done: but according to His mercy He saved us: by the washing of regeneration: and renewing of the Holy Ghost;
1Pe 3:21: The like figure to what even baptism does also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh: but the answer of a good conscience toward God: ) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

"blood"
1Jo 1:7: But if we walk in the light: as He is in the light: we have fellowship one with another: and the blood of Jesus Christ His Son cleanses us from all sin.
1Jo 4:10: Herein is love: not that we loved God: but that He loved us: and sent His Son to be the propitiation for our sins.
Le 17:11: For the life of the flesh is in the blood: and I have given it to you upon the altar to make an atonement for your souls: for it is the blood that makes an atonement for the soul.
Zec 9:11: As for you also: by the blood of your covenant I have sent forth your prisoners out of the pit wherein is no water.
Mt 26:28: For this is my blood of the new testament: which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
Mr 14:24: He said to them: This is my blood of the new testament: which is shed for many.
Lu 22:20: Likewise also the cup after supper: saying: This cup is the new testament in my blood: which is shed for you.
Joh 6:55: For my flesh is meat indeed: and my blood is drink indeed.
Ro 3:25: Whom God has set forth to be a propitiation through faith in His blood: to declare His righteousness for the remission of sins that are past: through the forbearance of God;
Eph 1:7: In whom we have redemption through his blood: the forgiveness of sins: according to the riches of his grace;
Col 1:4: Since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus: and of the love which you have to all the saints:
Heb 9:7: 14: But into the second went the high priest alone once every year: not without blood: which he offered for himself: and for the errors of the people:
Heb 10:29: Of how much sorer punishment: suppose you: will He be thought worthy: who has trodden under foot the Son of God: and has counted the blood of the covenant: wherewith He was sanctified: an unholy thing: and has done despite to the Spirit of grace?
Heb 12:24: To Jesus the mediator of the new covenant: and to the blood of sprinkling: that speaks better things than that of Abel.
Heb 13:20: Now the God of peace: that brought again from the dead our Lord Jesus: that great shepherd of the sheep: through the blood of the everlasting covenant:
1Pe 1:2: Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father: through sanctification of the Spirit: to obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you: and peace: be multiplied.
Re 1:5: From Jesus Christ: who is the faithful witness: and the first begotten of the dead: and the prince of the kings of the earth. To Him that loved us: and washed us from our sins in His own blood:
Re 5:9: They sung a new song: saying: You are worthy to take the book: and to open the seals thereof: for you were killed: and have redeemed us to God by your blood out of every kindred: and tongue: and people: and nation;
Re 7:14: I said to him: Sir: you know. And he said to me: These are they which came out of great tribulation: and have washed their robes: and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

"the Spirit that"
1Jo 5:7: 8: For there are 3 that bear record in heaven: the Father: the Word: and the Holy Ghost: and these 3 are one.
Joh 14:17: Even the Spirit of truth; whom the world cannot receive: because it sees Him not">not Him: neither knows Him: but you know Him; for He dwells with you: and will be in you.
Joh 15:26: But when the Comforter is come: whom I will send to you from the Father: even the Spirit of truth: which proceeds from the Father: He will testify of me:
1Ti 3:16: Without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh: justified in the Spirit: seen of angels: preached to the Gentiles: believed on in the world: received up into glory.

"is truth"
Joh 14:6: Jesus says to Him: I am the way: the truth: and the life: no man comes to the Father: but by me.
Joh 16:13: Howbeit when He: the Spirit of truth: is come: He will guide you into all truth: for He will not speak of Himself; but whatever He will hear: that will He speak: and He will show you things to come.

7 For there are 3 that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost: and these 3 are one.1 John 5:7
Stats
Rank: #250 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 114 characters, 18 words, 88 letters, 34 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Greek: οτι τρεις εισιν οι μαρτυρουντες εν τω ουρανω ο πατηρ ο λογος και το αγιον πνευμα και ουτοι οι τρεις εν εισιν

Lit: For three there are bearing testimony: in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Spirit — and these three one are.

KJV: For there are three that bear record in heaven, the Father, the Word, and the Holy Ghost: and these three are one.
References

"bear"
1Jo 5:10: 11: He who believes'>believes'>believes on the Son of God has the witness in Himself: He that'>He who believes'>believes'>believes not God has made Him a liar; because He believes'>believes'>believes not the record that God gave of His Son.
Joh 8:13: 14: The Pharisees therefore said to him: You bear record of yourself; your record not is true.

"The Father"

Mt 17:5: While He yet spoke: look: a bright cloud overshadowed them: and look a voice out of the cloud: which said: This is my beloved Son: in whom I am well pleased; hear you Him.
Mt 28:19: Go you therefore: and teach all nations: baptizing them in the name of the Father: and of the Son: and of the Holy Ghost:
Joh 5:26: For as the Father has life in Himself; so has He given to the Son to have life in Himself;

1Co 12:4-6: Now there are diversities of gifts: but the same Spirit.
2Co 13:14: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ: and the love of God: and the communion of the Holy Ghost: be with you all. Amen. The second [epistle to the Corinthians was written from Philippi: a city of Macedonia: by Titus and Lucas.]>>
Re 1:4: 5: John to the 7 churches which are in Asia: Grace be to you: and peace: from Him which is: and which was: and which is to come; and from the 7 Spirits which are before His throne;

"the Word"
1Jo 1:1: That which was from the beginning: which we have heard: which we have seen with our eyes: which we have looked upon: and our hands have handled: of the Word of life;
Joh 1:1: 32-34: In the beginning was the Word: and the Word was with God: and the Word was God.
Heb 4:12: 13: For the word of God is quick: and powerful: and sharper than any twoedged sword: piercing even to the dividing asunder of soul and spirit: and of the joints and marrow: and is a discerner of the thoughts and intents of the heart.
Re 19:13: He was clothed with a vesture dipped in blood: and His name is called The Word of God.

"the Holy"
1Jo 5:6: This is He that'>He who came by water and blood: even Jesus Christ; not by water only: but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that bears witness: because the Spirit is truth.
Mt 3:16: Jesus: when He was baptized: went up straightway out of the water: and: indeed: the heavens were opened to Him: and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove: and lighting upon Him:
Joh 1:33: I knew Him not">not Him: but He that'>He who sent me to baptize with water: the same said to me: Upon whom you will see the Spirit descending: and remaining on Him: the same is He which baptizes with the Holy Ghost.
Ac 2:33: Therefore being by the right hand of God exalted: and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Ghost: He has shed forth this: which you now see and hear.
Ac 5:32: We are His witnesses of these things; and so is also the Holy Ghost: whom God has given to them that obey Him.
Heb 2:3: 4: How will we escape: if we neglect so great salvation; which at the first began to be spoken by the Lord: and was confirmed to us by them that heard Him;

"and these"
De 6:4: Hear: O Israel: The LORD our God is one LORD:
Mt 28:19: Go you therefore: and teach all nations: baptizing them in the name of the Father: and of the Son: and of the Holy Ghost:
Joh 10:30: I and my Father are one.

G3588τὸto   (Art-NNS)

G4151ΠνεῦμαPneuma   (N-NNS)
G4151 πνεῦμα pneûma pnyoo-mah from πνέω; a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit, i.e. (human) the rational soul, (by implication) vital principle, mental disposition, etc., or (superhuman) an angel, demon, or (divine) God, Christs spirit, the Holy Spirit:--ghost, life, spirit(-ual, -ually), mind. Compare ψυχή. 		ΠνεῦμαPneuma Spirit N-NNS

G1519εἰςeis   (Prep)
G1519 εἰς eis ice a primary preposition; to or into (indicating the point reached or entered), of place, time, or (figuratively) purpose (result, etc.); also in adverbial phrases:--(abundant-)ly, against, among, as, at, (back-)ward, before, by, concerning, + continual, + far more exceeding, for (intent, purpose), fore, + forth, in (among, at, unto, -so much that, -to), to the intent that, + of one mind, + never, of, (up-)on, + perish, + set at one again, (so) that, therefore(-unto), throughout, til, to (be, the end, -ward), (here-)until(-to), …ward, (where-)fore, with. Often used in composition with the same general import, but only with verbs (etc.) expressing motion (literally or figuratively). 		εἰςeis in Prep

G1510εἰσιν.eisin   (V-PIA-3P)
G1510 εἰμί eimí i-mee the first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist (used only when emphatic):--am, have been, X it is I, was. See also εἶ, εἴην, εἶναι, εἰσί, ἦν, ἔσομαι, ἐσμέν, ἐστέ, ἐστί, κέρδος, ἴσθι, ὦ. 		εἰσιν.eisin are. V-PIA-3P
8 There are 3 that bear witness in earth, the spirit, and the water, and the blood: and these 3 agree in one.1 John 5:8
Stats
Rank: #958 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 119 characters, 19 words, 92 letters, 37 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Greek: και τρεις εισιν οι μαρτυρουντες εν τη γη το πνευμα και το υδωρ και το αιμα και οι τρεις εις το εν εισιν

Lit: the Spirit and the water and the blood— and these three in one are.

KJV: And there are three that bear witness in earth, the spirit, and the water, and the blood: and these three agree in one.
References

"there"
1Jo 5:7: For there are 3 that bear record in heaven: the Father: the Word: and the Holy Ghost: and these 3 are one.

"the spirit"
1Jo 5:6: This is He that'>He who came by water and blood: even Jesus Christ; not by water only: but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that bears witness: because the Spirit is truth.
Mt 26:26-28: As they were eating: Jesus took bread: and blessed it: and brake it: and gave it to the disciples: and said: Take: eat; this is my body.
Mt 28:19: Go you therefore: and teach all nations: baptizing them in the name of the Father: and of the Son: and of the Holy Ghost:
Joh 15:26: But when the Comforter is come: whom I will send to you from the Father: even the Spirit of truth: which proceeds from the Father: He will testify of me:
Ro 8:16: The Spirit itself bears witness with our spirit: that we are the children of God:
Heb 6:4: For it is impossible for those who were once enlightened: and have tasted of the heavenly gift: and were made partakers of the Holy Ghost:

"the water"
Ac 2:2-4: Suddenly there came a sound from heaven as of a rushing mighty wind: and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
2Co 1:22: Who has also sealed us: and given the ear of the Spirit in our hearts.

"the blood"
Heb 13:12: For what reason Jesus also: that He might sanctify the people with His own blood: suffered without the gate.
1Pe 3:21: The like figure to what even baptism does also now save us (not the putting away of the filth of the flesh: but the answer of a good conscience toward God: ) by the resurrection of Jesus Christ:

"and these"
Mr 14:56: For many bare false witness against him: but their witness not agreed together.
Ac 15:15: To this agree the words of the prophets; as it is written:

God’s Testimony about His Son

9 If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which He has testified of His Son.1 John 5:9
Stats
Counts: 131 characters, 25 words, 102 letters, 38 vowels, 64 consonants
Translation
Greek: ει την μαρτυριαν των ανθρωπων λαμβανομεν η μαρτυρια του θεου μειζων εστιν οτι αυτη εστιν η μαρτυρια του θεου ην μεμαρτυρηκεν περι του υιου αυτου

Lit: If the testimony of men we receive, the testimony of God greater is. For this is the testimony of God that He has testified concerning the Son of Him.

KJV: If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater: for this is the witness of God which he hath testified of his Son.
References

"we"
1Jo 5:10: He who believes'>believes'>believes on the Son of God has the witness in Himself: He that'>He who believes'>believes'>believes not God has made Him a liar; because He believes'>believes'>believes not the record that God gave of His Son.
Joh 3:32: 33: What he has seen and heard: that he testifieth; and no man receives his testimony.
Joh 5:31-36: 39: If I bear witness of myself: my witness not is true.
Joh 8:17-19: It is also written in your law: that the testimony of two men is true.
Joh 10:38: But if I do: though you not believe me: believe the works: that you may know: and believe: that the Father is in me: and I in Him.
Ac 5:32: We are His witnesses of these things; and so is also the Holy Ghost: whom God has given to them that obey Him.
Ac 17:31: Because he has appointed a day: in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he has ordained; whereof he has given assurance to all men: in that he has raised him from the dead.
Heb 2:4: God also bearing them witness: both with signs and wonders: and with divers miracles: and gifts of the Holy Ghost: according to His own will?
Heb 6:18: That by two immutable things: in which it was impossible for God to lie: we might have a strong consolation: who have fled for refuge to lay hold upon the hope set before us:

"for"
Mt 3:16: 17: Jesus: when He was baptized: went up straightway out of the water: and: indeed: the heavens were opened to Him: and He saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove: and lighting upon Him:
Mt 17:5: While He yet spoke: look: a bright cloud overshadowed them: and look a voice out of the cloud: which said: This is my beloved Son: in whom I am well pleased; hear you Him.

G4012περὶperi   (Prep)
G4012 περί perí per-ee from the base of πέραν; properly, through (all over), i.e. around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time (with the genitive case denoting the subject or occasion or superlative point; with the accusative case the locality, circuit, matter, circumstance or general period):--(there-)about, above, against, at, on behalf of, X and his company, which concern, (as) concerning, for, X how it will go with, ((there-, where-)) of, on, over, pertaining (to), for sake, X (e-)state, (as) touching, (where-)by (in), with. 10 He who believes'>believes'>believes on the Son of God has the witness in Himself: He that'>He who believes'>believes'>believes not God has made Him a liar; because He believes'>believes'>believes not the record that God gave of His Son.1 John 5:10
Stats
Counts: 174 characters, 33 words, 137 letters, 53 vowels, 84 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο πιστευων εις τον υιον του θεου εχει την μαρτυριαν εν εαυτω ο μη πιστευων τω θεω ψευστην πεποιηκεν αυτον οτι ου πεπιστευκεν εις την μαρτυριαν ην μεμαρτυρηκεν ο θεος περι του υιου αυτου

Lit: The one believing in the Son of God has the testimony in himself. The one not believing God, a liar has made Him, because not he has believed in the testimony that has testified God concerning the Son Him.

KJV: He that believeth on the Son of God hath the witness in himself: he that believeth not God hath made him a liar; because he believeth not the record that God gave of his Son.
References

"that believeth on"
1Jo 5:1: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God: and every one that loves'>loves Him that begot loves'>loves Him also that is begotten of Him.
Joh 3:16: For God so loved the world: that He gave His only begotten Son: that whoever believes in Him not should perish: but have everlasting life.

"hath the"
Ps 25:14: The secret of the LORD is with them that fear Him; and He will show them His covenant.
Pr 3:32: For the froward is abomination to the LORD: but His secret is with the righteous.
Ro 8:16: The Spirit itself bears witness with our spirit: that we are the children of God:
Ga 4:6: Because you are sons: God has sent forth the Spirit of His Son into your hearts: crying: Abba: Father.
Col 3:3: For you are dead: and your life is hid with Christ in God.
2Pe 1:19: We have also a more sure word of prophecy; to what you do well that you take heed: as to a light that shines in a dark place: until the day dawn: and the day star arise in your hearts:
Re 2:17: 28: He who has an ear: let Him hear what the Spirit says to the churches; To Him that overcomes will I give to eat of the hidden manna: and will give Him a white stone: and in the stone a new name written: which no man knows saving He that'>He who receives it.

"hath made"
1Jo 1:10: If we say that we not have sinned: we make him a liar: and his word not is in us.
Nu 23:19: God is not a man: that He should lie; neither the son of man: that He should repent: has He said: and will He not">not He do it? or has He spoken: and will He not">not He make it good?
Job 24:25: If it be not so now: who will make me a liar: and make my not speechhing worth?
Isa 53:1: Who has believed our report? and to whom is the arm of the LORD revealed?
Jer 15:18: Why is my pain perpetual: and my wound incurable: which refuses to be healed? will you be altogether to me as a liar: and as waters that fail?
Joh 3:33: He who has received His testimony has set to His seal that God is true.
Joh 5:38: you not have his word abiding in you: for whom he has sent: him you not believe.
Heb 3:12: Take heed: brothers: lest there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief: in departing from the living God.

11 This is the record, that God has given to us eternal life, and this life is in His Son.1 John 5:11
Stats
Rank: #599 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 92 characters, 18 words, 70 letters, 26 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Greek: και αυτη εστιν η μαρτυρια οτι ζωην αιωνιον εδωκεν ημιν ο θεος και αυτη η ζωη εν τω υιω αυτου εστιν

Lit: And this is the testimony, that life eternal has given God to us, and this the life in the Son His is.

KJV: And this is the record, that God hath given to us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.
References

"this"
1Jo 5:12: 20: He who has the Son has life; and He that'>He who has not the Son of God has not life.
1Jo 1:1-3: That which was from the beginning: which we have heard: which we have seen with our eyes: which we have looked upon: and our hands have handled: of the Word of life;
1Jo 4:9: In this was manifested the love of God toward us: because that God sent His only begotten Son into the world: that we might live through Him.
Joh 1:4: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
Joh 5:21: 26: For as the Father raises up the dead: and quickens'>quickens them; even so the Son quickens'>quickens whom He will.
Joh 11:25: 26: Jesus said to her: I am the resurrection: and the life: He that'>He who believes in me: though He were dead: yet will He live:
Joh 14:6: Jesus says to Him: I am the way: the truth: and the life: no man comes to the Father: but by me.
Col 3:3: 4: For you are dead: and your life is hid with Christ in God.
Re 22:1: He showed me a pure river of water of life: clear as crystal: proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb.

"God"
1Jo 5:13: These things have I written to you that believe on the name of the Son of God; that you may know that you have eternal life: and that you may believe on the name of the Son of God.
1Jo 2:25: This is the promise that he has promised us: even eternal life.
Mt 25:46: These will go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.
Joh 3:15: 16: 36: That whoever believes in him not should perish: but have eternal life.
Joh 4:4: 36: He must needs go through Samaria.
Joh 6:40: 47: 68: This is the will of Him that sent me: that every one which sees the Son: and believes on Him: may have everlasting life: and I will raise Him up at the last day.
Joh 10:28: I give to them eternal life; and they will never perish: neither will any man pluck them out of my hand.
Joh 12:50: I know that His commandment is life everlasting: whatever I speak therefore: even as the Father said to me: so I speak.
Joh 17:2: 3: As you have given him power over all flesh: that he should give eternal life to as many as you have given him.
Ro 5:21: That as sin has reigned to death: even so might grace reign through righteousness to eternal life by Jesus Christ our Lord.
Ro 6:23: For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
1Ti 1:16: Howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy: that in me first Jesus Christ might show forth all longsuffering: for a pattern to them which should hereafter believe on Him to life everlasting.
Tit 1:2: In hope of eternal life: which God: that cannot lie: promised before the world began;
Jude 1:21: Keep yourselves in the love of God: looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ to eternal life.

G3756οὐκouk   (Adv)

G2192ἔχει.echei   (V-PIA-3S)
G2192 ἔχω échō skheh-o a primary verb; to hold (used in very various applications, literally or figuratively, direct or remote; such as possession; ability, contiuity, relation, or condition):--be (able, X hold, possessed with), accompany, + begin to amend, can(+ -not), X conceive, count, diseased, do + eat, + enjoy, + fear, following, have, hold, keep, + lack, + go to law, lie, + must needs, + of necessity, + need, next, + recover, + reign, + rest, + return, X sick, take for, + tremble, + uncircumcised, use. 		ἔχει.echei has. 12 He who has the Son has life; and He that'>He who has not the Son of God has not life.1 John 5:12
Stats
Rank: #1595 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 82 characters, 18 words, 62 letters, 21 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Greek: ο εχων τον υιον εχει την ζωην ο μη εχων τον υιον του θεου την ζωην ουκ εχει

Lit: The one having the Son has life; the one not having the Son of God, life not has.

KJV: He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.
References

"that hath the"
1Jo 2:23: 24: Whoever denies the Son: the same has not the Father: (but) He that'>He who acknowledges the Son has the Father also.
Joh 1:12: But as many as received Him: to them gave He power to become the sons of God: even to them that believe on His name:
Joh 3:36: He who believes'>believes on the Son has everlasting life: and He that'>He who believes'>believes not the Son will not see life; but the wrath of God abides on Him.
Joh 5:24: Truly: truly: I say to you: He who hears my word: and believes on him that sent me: has everlasting life: and will not come into condemnation; but is passed from death to life.
1Co 1:30: But of Him are you in Christ Jesus: who of God is made to us wisdom: and righteousness: and sanctification: and redemption:
Ga 2:20: I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; not yet I: but Christ lives in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God: who loved me: and gave Himself for me.
Heb 3:14: For we are made partakers of Christ: if we hold the beginning of our confidence stedfast to the end;
2Jo 1:9: Whoever transgresss: and abides'>abides not in the doctrine of Christ: has not God. He who abides'>abides in the doctrine of Christ: He has both the Father and the Son.

"and he"
Mr 16:16: He who believes'>believes and is baptized will be saved; but he who believes'>believes not will be damned.
Joh 3:36: He who believes'>believes on the Son has everlasting life: and He that'>He who believes'>believes not the Son will not see life; but the wrath of God abides on Him.

G2443ἵναhina   (Conj)
